member.name: T:Nest.IDateHistogramCompositeAggregationSource
member.summary: A values source that can be applied on date values to build fixed size interval over the values. The interval parameter defines a date/time expression that determines how values should be transformed. For instance an interval set to month will translate any values to its closest month interval..

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramCompositeAggregationSource.Format
member.summary: Return a formatted date string as the key instead an epoch long
member.remarks: Valid for Elasticsearch 6.3.0+

member.name: P:Nest.IDateHistogramCompositeAggregationSource.Interval
member.summary: The interval to use when bucketing documents

member.name: T:Nest.IHistogramCompositeAggregationSource
member.summary: A value source that can be applied on numeric values to build fixed size interval over the values. The interval parameter defines how the numeric values should be transformed. For instance an interval set to 5 will translate any numeric values to its closest interval, a value of 101 would be translated to 100 which is the key for the interval between 100 and 105.

member.name: P:Nest.FiltersAggregation.OtherBucket
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to add a bucket to the response which will contain all documents that do not match any of the given filters. When set to true, the other bucket will be returned either in a bucket (named "_other_" by default) if named filters are being used, or as the last bucket if anonymous filters are being used When set to false, does not compute the other bucket.

member.name: P:Nest.FiltersAggregation.OtherBucketKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the key for the other bucket to a value other than the default "_other_". Setting this parameter will implicitly set the parameter to true

member.name: M:Nest.FiltersAggregationDescriptor`1.OtherBucket(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds a bucket to the response which will contain all documents that do not match any of the given filters. When set to true, the other bucket will be returned either in a bucket (named "_other_" by default) if named filters are being used, or as the last bucket if anonymous filters are being used When set to false, does not compute the other bucket.
member.param: whether to set the other bucket

member.name: M:Nest.FiltersAggregationDescriptor`1.OtherBucketKey(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the key for the other bucket to a value other than the default "_other_". Setting this parameter will implicitly set the parameter to true
member.param: the name for the other bucket

member.name: P:Nest.ISignificantTermsAggregation.PercentageScore
member.summary:
Use percentage to calculate significance score.
A simple calculation of the number of documents in the foreground sample with a term divided by the number of documents in the background with the term. By default this produces a score greater than zero and less than one.

member.summary: Use a script to calculate a custom significance score.

member.name: T:Nest.IMedianAbsoluteDeviationAggregation
member.summary:
This single-value aggregation approximates the median absolute deviation of its search results.
Median absolute deviation is a measure of variability. It is a robust statistic, meaning that it is useful for describing data that may have outliers, or may not be normally distributed. For such data it can be more descriptive than standard deviation.
It is calculated as the median of each data point’s deviation from the median of the entire sample. That is, for a random variable X, the median absolute deviation is median(|median(X) - Xi|).

member.name: P:Nest.IMedianAbsoluteDeviationAggregation.Compression
member.summary: TDigest algorithm component that controls memory usage and approximation error. By increasing the compression value, you can increase the accuracy at the cost of more memory. Larger compression values also make the algorithm slower since the underlying tree data structure grows in size, resulting in more expensive operations. The default compression value is 100.

member.name: T:Nest.IBucketSortAggregation
member.summary: A parent pipeline aggregation which sorts the buckets of its parent multi-bucket aggregation. Zero or more sort fields may be specified together with the corresponding sort order. Each bucket may be sorted based on its _key, _count or its sub-aggregations. In addition, parameters from and size may be set in order to truncate the result buckets.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzersDescriptor.Custom(System.String,System.Func{Nest.CustomAnalyzerDescriptor,Nest.ICustomAnalyzer})
member.summary:
An analyzer of type custom that allows to combine a Tokenizer with zero or more Token Filters, and zero or more Char Filters.
The custom analyzer accepts a logical/registered name of the tokenizer to use, and a list of logical/registered names of token filters.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzersDescriptor.Keyword(System.String,System.Func{Nest.KeywordAnalyzerDescriptor,Nest.IKeywordAnalyzer})
member.summary:
An analyzer of type keyword that “tokenizes” an entire stream as a single token. This is useful for data like zip codes, ids and so on.
Note, when using mapping definitions, it make more sense to simply mark the field as not_analyzed.

An analyzer of type snowball that uses the standard tokenizer, with standard filter, lowercase filter, stop filter, and snowball filter.

member.name: T:Nest.ICustomNormalizer
member.summary:
Normalizers are similar to analyzers except that they may only emit a single token. As a consequence, they do not have a tokenizer and only accept a subset of the available char filters and token filters. Only the filters that work on a per-character basis are allowed. For instance a lowercasing filter would be allowed, but not a stemming filter, which needs to look at the keyword as a whole.
Elasticsearch does not ship with built-in normalizers so far, so the only way to create one is through composing a custom one

member.summary: Char filters to normalize the keyword

member.summary: Elasticsearch does not ship with built-in normalizers so far, so the only way to get one is by building a custom one. Custom normalizers take a list of char character filters and a list of token filters.

member.name: T:Nest.IcuCollationAlternate
member.summary: Sets the alternate handling for strength quaternary to be either shifted or non-ignorable. Which boils down to ignoring punctuation and whitespace.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: T:Nest.IcuCollationCaseFirst
member.summary: Controls which case is sorted first when case is not ignored for strength tertiary. The default depends on the collation.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: T:Nest.IcuCollationDecomposition
member.summary: Setting this decomposition property to canonical allows the Collator to handle unnormalized text properly, producing the same results as if the text were normalized. If no is set, it is the user’s responsibility to insure that all text is already in the appropriate form before a comparison or before getting a CollationKey. Adjusting decomposition mode allows the user to select between faster and more complete collation behavior. Since a great many of the world’s languages do not require text normalization, most locales set no as the default decomposition mode.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: T:Nest.IcuCollationStrength
member.summary: The strength property determines the minimum level of difference considered significant during comparison. See also: http://icu-project.org/apiref/icu4j/com/ibm/icu/text/Collator.html
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.name: F:Nest.IcuCollationStrength.Primary
member.summary: Typically, this is used to denote differences between base characters (for example, "a" < "b"). It is the strongest difference. For example, dictionaries are divided into different sections by base character.

member.name: F:Nest.IcuCollationStrength.Secondary
member.summary: Accents in the characters are considered secondary differences (for example, "as" < "às" < "at"). Other differences between letters can also be considered secondary differences, depending on the language. A secondary difference is ignored when there is a primary difference anywhere in the strings.

member.name: F:Nest.IcuCollationStrength.Tertiary
member.summary: Upper and lower case differences in characters are distinguished at tertiary strength (for example, "ao" < "Ao" < "aò"). In addition, a variant of a letter differs from the base form on the tertiary strength (such as "A" and "Ⓐ"). Another example is the difference between large and small Kana. A tertiary difference is ignored when there is a primary or secondary difference anywhere in the strings.

member.name: F:Nest.IcuCollationStrength.Quaternary
member.summary: When punctuation is ignored (see Ignoring Punctuations in the User Guide) at PRIMARY to TERTIARY strength, an additional strength level can be used to distinguish words with and without punctuation (for example, "ab" < "a-b" < "aB"). This difference is ignored when there is a PRIMARY, SECONDARY or TERTIARY difference. The QUATERNARY strength should only be used if ignoring punctuation is required.

member.name: F:Nest.IcuCollationStrength.Indentical
member.summary: When all other strengths are equal, the IDENTICAL strength is used as a tiebreaker. The Unicode code point values of the NFD form of each string are compared, just in case there is no difference. For example, Hebrew cantellation marks are only distinguished at this strength. This strength should be used sparingly, as only code point value differences between two strings is an extremely rare occurrence. Using this strength substantially decreases the performance for both comparison and collation key generation APIs. This strength also increases the size of the collation key.

member.name: T:Nest.IIcuTokenizer
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables.
member.remarks: Requires analysis-icu plugin to be installed

member.summary: The tokenization mode determines how the tokenizer handles compound and unknown words. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: F:Nest.KuromojiTokenizationMode.Normal
member.summary: Normal segmentation, no decomposition for compounds

member.name: F:Nest.KuromojiTokenizationMode.Search
member.summary: Segmentation geared towards search. This includes a decompounding process for long nouns, also including the full compound token as a synonym.

member.name: F:Nest.KuromojiTokenizationMode.Extended
member.summary: Extended mode outputs unigrams for unknown words.

member.name: T:Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: P:Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer.DiscardPunctuation
member.summary: Whether punctuation should be discarded from the output. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer.Mode
member.summary: The tokenization mode determines how the tokenizer handles compound and unknown words.

member.name: P:Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer.NBestCost
member.summary: The nbest_cost parameter specifies an additional Viterbi cost. The KuromojiTokenizer will include all tokens in Viterbi paths that are within the nbest_cost value of the best path.

member.name: P:Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer.NBestExamples
member.summary: The nbest_examples can be used to find a nbest_cost value based on examples. For example, a value of /箱根山-箱根/成田空港-成田/ indicates that in the texts, 箱根山 (Mt. Hakone) and 成田空港 (Narita Airport) we’d like a cost that gives is us 箱根 (Hakone) and 成田 (Narita).

member.name: P:Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer.UserDictionary
member.summary: The Kuromoji tokenizer uses the MeCab-IPADIC dictionary by default. A user_dictionary may be appended to the default dictionary.

member.name: T:Nest.IAsciiFoldingTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: T:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type shingle that constructs shingles (token n-grams) from a token stream.
In other words, it creates combinations of tokens as a single token.

member.name: P:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter.FillerToken
member.summary: The string to use as a replacement for each position at which there is no actual token in the stream. For instance this string is used if the position increment is greater than one when a stop filter is used together with the shingle filter. Defaults to "_"

member.name: P:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter.MaxShingleSize
member.summary: The maximum shingle size. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter.MinShingleSize
member.summary: The minimum shingle size. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter.OutputUnigrams
member.summary: If true the output will contain the input tokens (unigrams) as well as the shingles. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter.OutputUnigramsIfNoShingles
member.summary:
If output_unigrams is false the output will contain the input tokens (unigrams) if no shingles are available.
Note if output_unigrams is set to true this setting has no effect. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IShingleTokenFilter.TokenSeparator
member.summary: The string to use when joining adjacent tokens to form a shingle. Defaults to " ".

member.name: P:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter.FillerToken
member.summary: The string to use as a replacement for each position at which there is no actual token in the stream. For instance this string is used if the position increment is greater than one when a stop filter is used together with the shingle filter. Defaults to "_"

member.name: T:Nest.IStopTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type stop that removes stop words from token streams.

member.name: P:Nest.IStopTokenFilter.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Set to true to lower case all words first. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IStopTokenFilter.RemoveTrailing
member.summary: Set to false in order to not ignore the last term of a search if it is a stop word. This is very useful for the completion suggester as a query like green a can be extended to green apple even though you remove stop words in general. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IStopTokenFilter.StopWords
member.summary: A list of stop words to use. Defaults to `_english_` stop words.

member.name: P:Nest.IStopTokenFilter.StopWordsPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a stopwords file configuration. Each stop word should be in its own "line" (separated by a line break). The file must be UTF-8 encoded.

member.summary: The kuromoji_readingform token filter replaces the token with its reading form in either katakana or romaji. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiPartOfSpeech(System.String,System.Func{Nest.KuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_part_of_speech token filter removes tokens that match a set of part-of-speech tags. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuCollation(System.String,System.Func{Nest.IcuCollationTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuCollationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Collations are used for sorting documents in a language-specific word order. The icu_collation token filter is available to all indices and defaults to using the DUCET collation, which is a best-effort attempt at language-neutral sorting. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuFolding(System.String,System.Func{Nest.IcuFoldingTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuFoldingTokenFilter})
member.summary: Case folding of Unicode characters based on UTR#30, like the ASCII-folding token filter on steroids. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuNormalization(System.String,System.Func{Nest.IcuNormalizationTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuNormalizationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Normalizes as defined here: http://userguide.icu-project.org/transforms/normalization Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuTransform(System.String,System.Func{Nest.IcuTransformTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuTransformTokenFilter})
member.summary: Transforms are used to process Unicode text in many different ways, such as case mapping, normalization, transliteration and bidirectional text handling. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.Multiplexer(System.String,System.Func{Nest.MultiplexerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IMultiplexerTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type multiplexer will emit multiple tokens at the same position, each version of the token having been run through a different filter. Identical output tokens at the same position will be removed.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenFiltersDescriptor.RemoveDuplicates(System.String,System.Func{Nest.RemoveDuplicatesTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IRemoveDuplicatesTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type remove_duplicates that drops identical tokens at the same position.

member.name: T:Nest.ITrimTokenFilter
member.summary: The trim token filter trims surrounding whitespaces around a token.

member.name: T:Nest.ITruncateTokenFilter
member.summary:
The truncate token filter can be used to truncate tokens into a specific length. This can come in handy with keyword (single token)
based mapped fields that are used for sorting in order to reduce memory usage.

member.name: P:Nest.ITruncateTokenFilter.Length
member.summary: length parameter which control the number of characters to truncate to, defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Nest.TruncateTokenFilter.Length
member.summary: length parameter which control the number of characters to truncate to, defaults to 10.

member.name: M:Nest.TruncateTokenFilterDescriptor.Length(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: length parameter which control the number of characters to truncate to, defaults to 10.

member.name: T:Nest.IUniqueTokenFilter
member.summary: The unique token filter can be used to only index unique tokens during analysis. By default it is applied on all the token stream

member.name: P:Nest.IUniqueTokenFilter.OnlyOnSamePosition
member.summary: If only_on_same_position is set to true, it will only remove duplicate tokens on the same position.

member.name: P:Nest.UniqueTokenFilter.OnlyOnSamePosition
member.summary: If only_on_same_position is set to true, it will only remove duplicate tokens on the same position.

member.name: M:Nest.UniqueTokenFilterDescriptor.OnlyOnSamePosition(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: If only_on_same_position is set to true, it will only remove duplicate tokens on the same position.

member.name: T:Nest.IUppercaseTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type uppercase that normalizes token text to upper case.

member.name: T:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter
member.summary: Named word_delimiter, it Splits words into subwords and performs optional transformations on subword groups. Unlike the word_delimiter this token filter named word_delimiter_graph correctly handles multi terms expansion at query time.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.AdjustOffsets
member.summary: By default, the filter tries to output subtokens with adjusted offsets to reflect their actual position in the token stream. However, when used in combination with other filters that alter the length or starting position of tokens without changing their offsets (e.g. ) this can cause tokens with illegal offsets to be emitted. Setting to false will stop from adjusting these internal offsets.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.CatenateAll
member.summary: If true causes all subword parts to be catenated: "wi-fi-4000" ⇒ "wifi4000". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.CatenateNumbers
member.summary: If true causes maximum runs of number parts to be catenated: "500-42" ⇒ "50042". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.CatenateWords
member.summary: If true causes maximum runs of word parts to be catenated: "wi-fi" ⇒ "wifi". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.GenerateNumberParts
member.summary: If true causes number subwords to be generated: "500-42" ⇒ "500" "42". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.GenerateWordParts
member.summary: If true causes parts of words to be generated: "PowerShot" ⇒ "Power" "Shot". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.PreserveOriginal
member.summary: If true includes original words in subwords: "500-42" ⇒ "500-42" "500" "42". Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.ProtectedWords
member.summary: A list of protected words from being delimiter.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.ProtectedWordsPath
member.summary: protected_words_path which resolved to a file configured with protected words (one on each line). Automatically resolves to config/ based location if exists.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.SplitOnCaseChange
member.summary: If true causes "PowerShot" to be two tokens; ("Power-Shot" remains two parts regards). Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.SplitOnNumerics
member.summary: If true causes "j2se" to be three tokens; "j" "2" "se". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.StemEnglishPossessive
member.summary: If true causes trailing "'s" to be removed for each subword: "O’Neil’s" ⇒ "O", "Neil". Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.TypeTable
member.summary: A custom type mapping table

member.name: P:Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter.TypeTablePath
member.summary: A path to a custom type mapping table file

member.name: T:Nest.ICharGroupTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer that breaks text into terms whenever it encounters a character which is in a defined set. It is mostly useful for cases where a simple custom tokenization is desired, and the overhead of use of is not acceptable.

member.name: P:Nest.ICharGroupTokenizer.TokenizeOnCharacters
member.summary: A list containing a list of characters to tokenize the string on. Whenever a character from this list is encountered, a new token is started. This accepts either single characters like eg. -, or character groups: whitespace, letter, digit, punctuation, symbol.

member.name: P:Nest.CharGroupTokenizer.TokenizeOnCharacters
member.summary: A list containing a list of characters to tokenize the string on. Whenever a character from this list is encountered, a new token is started. This accepts either single characters like eg. -, or character groups: whitespace, letter, digit, punctuation, symbol.

member.name: M:Nest.CharGroupTokenizerDescriptor.TokenizeOnCharacters(System.String[])

member.name: M:Nest.CharGroupTokenizerDescriptor.TokenizeOnCharacters(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: A list containing a list of characters to tokenize the string on. Whenever a character from this list is encountered, a new token is started. This accepts either single characters like eg. -, or character groups: whitespace, letter, digit, punctuation, symbol.

member.name: T:Nest.IKeywordTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: P:Nest.IKeywordTokenizer.BufferSize
member.summary: The term buffer size. Defaults to 256.

member.name: P:Nest.KeywordTokenizer.BufferSize
member.summary: The term buffer size. Defaults to 256.

member.name: M:Nest.KeywordTokenizerDescriptor.BufferSize(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: The term buffer size. Defaults to 256.

member.name: T:Nest.ILetterTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. That’s to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: T:Nest.ILowercaseTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: T:Nest.IStandardTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type standard providing grammar based tokenizer that is a good tokenizer for most European language documents.
The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: P:Nest.IStandardTokenizer.MaxTokenLength
member.summary: The maximum token length. If a token is seen that exceeds this length then it is discarded. Defaults to 255.

member.name: M:Nest.StandardTokenizerDescriptor.MaxTokenLength(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: The maximum token length. If a token is seen that exceeds this length then it is discarded. Defaults to 255.

member.summary: A tokenizer of type edgeNGram.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.NGram(System.String,System.Func{Nest.NGramTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.INGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type nGram.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Keyword(System.String,System.Func{Nest.KeywordTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IKeywordTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Letter(System.String,System.Func{Nest.LetterTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.ILetterTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. That’s to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Lowercase(System.String,System.Func{Nest.LowercaseTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.ILowercaseTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.PathHierarchy(System.String,System.Func{Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IPathHierarchyTokenizer})
member.summary:
The path_hierarchy tokenizer takes something like this:
/something/something/else
And produces tokens:
/something
/something/something
/something/something/else

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Pattern(System.String,System.Func{Nest.PatternTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IPatternTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Standard(System.String,System.Func{Nest.StandardTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IStandardTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type standard providing grammar based tokenizer that is a good tokenizer for most European language documents.
The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.UaxEmailUrl(System.String,System.Func{Nest.UaxEmailUrlTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IUaxEmailUrlTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type uax_url_email which works exactly like the standard tokenizer, but tokenizes emails and urls as single tokens

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Whitespace(System.String,System.Func{Nest.WhitespaceTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IWhitespaceTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type whitespace that divides text at whitespace.

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Kuromoji(System.String,System.Func{Nest.KuromojiTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.TokenizersDescriptor.Icu(System.String,System.Func{Nest.IcuTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IIcuTokenizer})
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: T:Nest.IUaxEmailUrlTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type uax_url_email which works exactly like the standard tokenizer, but tokenizes emails and urls as single tokens

member.summary: The maximum token length. If a token is seen that exceeds this length then it is discarded. Defaults to 255.

member.name: P:Nest.IResponse.IsValid
member.summary:
Checks if a response is functionally valid or not. This is a NEST abstraction to have a single property to check whether there was something wrong with a request.
For instance, an Elasticsearch bulk response always returns 200 and individual bulk items may fail, will be false in that case.
You can also configure the client to always throw an using if the response is not valid

member.name: P:Nest.IResponse.OriginalException
member.summary:
If the request resulted in an exception on the client side this will hold the exception that was thrown.
This property is a shortcut to 's and is possibly set when is false depending on the cause of the error
You can also configure the client to always throw an using if the response is not valid

member.name: P:Nest.IResponse.ServerError
member.summary:
If the response results in an error on Elasticsearch's side an error element will be returned, this is mapped to in NEST.
Possibly set when is false, depending on the cause of the error
You can also configure the client to always throw an using if the response is not valid

member.name: M:Nest.CreateFollowIndexDescriptor.MaxWriteBufferSize(System.String)

member.name: M:Nest.CreateFollowIndexDescriptor.MaxRetryDelay(Nest.Time)

member.name: M:Nest.CreateFollowIndexDescriptor.ReadPollTimeout(Nest.Time)
member.summary: the maximum time to wait for new operations on the remote cluster when the follower index is synchronized with the leader index; when the timeout has elapsed, the poll for operations will return to the follower so that it can update some statistics, and then the follower will immediately attempt to read from the leader again

member.name: M:Nest.GraphExploreDescriptor`1.Routing(Nest.Routing)
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: M:Nest.FlushDescriptor.Force(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Whether a flush should be forced even if it is not necessarily needed ie. if no changes will be committed to the index. This is useful if transaction log IDs should be incremented even if no uncommitted changes are present. (This setting can be considered as internal)

member.name: M:Nest.FlushDescriptor.IgnoreUnavailable(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

member.name: M:Nest.FlushDescriptor.WaitIfOngoing(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: If set to true the flush operation will block until the flush can be executed if another flush operation is already executing. The default is true. If set to false the flush will be skipped iff if another flush operation is already running.

member.name: M:Nest.PutMappingDescriptor`1.AutoMap(Nest.IPropertyVisitor,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Convenience method to map as much as it can based on ElasticType attributes set on the type.
This method also automatically sets up mappings for primitive values types (e.g. int, long, double, DateTime...)
Class types default to object and Enums to int
Later calls can override whatever is set by this call.

member.name: M:Nest.MultiSearchDescriptor.PreFilterShardSize(System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on it's rewrite method ie. if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

member.summary: only perform the update operation if the last operation that has changed the document has the specified primary term

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.IfSequenceNumber(System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: only perform the update operation if the last operation that has changed the document has the specified sequence number

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.Lang(System.String)
member.summary: The script language (default: painless)

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.Refresh(System.Nullable{Elasticsearch.Net.Refresh})
member.summary: If `true` then refresh the effected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` (the default) then do nothing with refreshes.

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.RetryOnConflict(System.Nullable{System.Int64})
member.summary: Specify how many times should the operation be retried when a conflict occurs (default: 0)

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.Routing(Nest.Routing)
member.summary:
A document is routed to a particular shard in an index using the following formula
shard_num = hash(_routing) % num_primary_shards
Elasticsearch will use the document id if not provided.
For requests that are constructed from/for a document NEST will automatically infer the routing key if that document has a or a routing mapping on for its type exists on

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.SourceEnabled(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Whether the _source should be included in the response.

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.Timeout(Nest.Time)
member.summary: Explicit operation timeout

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.WaitForActiveShards(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the update operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.Upsert(`0)
member.summary: The full document to be created if an existing document does not exist for a partial merge.

member.name: M:Nest.UpdateDescriptor`2.Doc(`1)
member.summary: The partial update document to be merged on to the existing object.

member.name: M:Nest.RestoreDescriptor.Partial(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary:
Allow partial restore for indices that don't have snapshots of all shards available.
By default, the entire restore operation will fail if one or more indices participating in the operation don’t have snapshots of all shards available. It can occur if some shards failed to snapshot for example. It is still possible to restore such indices by setting to true. Only successfully snapshotted shards will be restored in this case and all missing shards will be recreated empty.

member.name: T:Nest.ClearSqlCursorDescriptor
member.summary:
Descriptor for ClearCursor
Clear SQL cursor

members.member:
You’ve reached the last page when there is no cursor returned in the results. Like Elasticsearch’s scroll, SQL may keep state in Elasticsearch to support the cursor. Unlike scroll, receiving the last page is enough to guarantee that the Elasticsearch state is cleared.
>

member.name: T:Nest.QuerySqlDescriptor
member.summary:
Descriptor for Query
Execute SQL

member.name: M:Nest.QuerySqlDescriptor.Format(System.String)
member.summary: a short version of the Accept header, e.g. json, yaml

members.member:
Continue to the next page by sending back the cursor field returned in the previous response.
You’ve reached the last page when there is no cursor returned in the results. Like Elasticsearch’s scroll, SQL may keep state in Elasticsearch to support the cursor. Unlike scroll, receiving the last page is enough to guarantee that the Elasticsearch state is cleared.
>

Return the results in a columnar fashion: one row represents all the values of a certain column from the current page of results. The following formats can be returned in columnar orientation: json, yaml, cbor and smile.
>

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.BulkAll``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{Nest.BulkAllDescriptor{``0},Nest.IBulkAllRequest{``0}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
BulkAll is a generic helper that will partition any lazy stream of documents and send them to Elasticsearch as concurrent bulk requests.
The index to target will be inferred from . If no default index has been mapped for using on , an exception will be thrown. Inference can be overridden using , and in addition, an index can be specified for each document using .

member.summary: Creates a new typed document in a specific index. If a document with the same index, type and id already exists, A 409 Conflict HTTP response status code and error will be returned.

1. Id property set up on for

Optionally further describe the create operation i.e override type/index/id

member.name: M:Nest.ElasticClient.BulkAll``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{Nest.BulkAllDescriptor{``0},Nest.IBulkAllRequest{``0}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
BulkAll is a generic helper that will partition any lazy stream of documents and send them to Elasticsearch as concurrent bulk requests
The index to target will be inferred from . If no default index has been mapped for using on , an exception will be thrown. Inference can be overridden using , and in addition, an index can be specified for each document using .

member.name: M:Nest.ElasticClient.CreateDocument``1(``0)
member.summary: Creates a new typed document in a specific index. If a document with the same index, type and id already exists, A 409 Conflict HTTP response status code and error will be returned.
member.typeparam: The document type used to infer the default index, type and id
member.param:
The document to be created. Id will be inferred from (in order):
1. Id property set up on for
2. property on applied to
3. A property named Id on
Optionally further describe the create operation i.e override type/index/id

member.name: T:Nest.BulkOperationsCollection`1
member.summary: This class is used by which needs thread safe adding as well as expose an equivalent of . Because operations from Elasticsearch are executed in order none of the types in System.Collection.Concurrent can't be used for this. We need to preserve insert order and exposed indexed index because is ordered and lines up with allowing one to zip the two together.

member.name: P:Nest.BulkRequest.WaitForActiveShards
member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the bulk operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. member.name: T:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation
member.summary: An operation to define the calculation of term vectors when using Multi termvectors API

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Document
member.summary: A document not indexed in Elasticsearch, to generate term vectors for

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.FieldStatistics
member.summary:
Whether to include field statistics. When set to false,
- document count (how many documents contain this field)
- sum of document frequencies (the sum of document frequencies for all terms in this field)
- sum of total term frequencies (the sum of total term frequencies of each term in this field)
will be omitted. Default is true.

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Filter
member.summary: Filter terms based on their tf-idf scores. This can be useful in order find out a good characteristic vector of a document.

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Id
member.summary: The id of the document

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Index
member.summary: The index in which the document resides

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Offsets
member.summary: Whether to include the start and end offsets. Default is true.

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Payloads
member.summary: Whether to include the term payloads as base64 encoded bytes. Default is true

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Positions
member.summary: Whether to include the term positions. Default is true

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Routing
member.summary: When requesting term vectors for , a shard to get the statistics from is randomly selected. Use only to hit a particular shard.

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.Fields
member.summary: The document field to generate term vectors for

member.name: P:Nest.IMultiTermVectorOperation.TermStatistics
member.summary:
Whether to include term statistics. When set to true,
- total term frequency (how often a term occurs in all documents)
- document frequency (the number of documents containing the current term)
will be returned. Default is false since term statistics can have a large performance impact.

member.name: T:Nest.IReindexRequest`2
member.summary:
A reindex implementation that uses ScrollAll() BulkAll() to compose a reindex pipeline.
This differs from ReindexOnServer() in that documents are fetched from Elasticsearch, transformed on the client side, then sent back to Elasticsearch.
This will create the target index if it doesn't exist already. If is not specified and the source of the reindex points to a single index we try and reuse the settings from source. You can completely opt out of all of this using

member.name: P:Nest.IReindexRequest`2.BackPressureFactor
member.summary:
The scroll typically outperforms the bulk operations by a long shot. If we'd leave things unbounded you'd quickly have way too many pending scroll requests. What this property allows you to express is that for each bucket in the max concurrency of the minimum max concurrency between producer and consumer amply the maximum overal pending of the other side by this factor. Typically the concurrency of the consumer (bulkall) will be lower and with this factor we can dampen the overall pending scroll requests while we are still processing bulk requests.
defaults to 4 if not provided

member.name: P:Nest.IReindexRequest`2.BulkAll
member.summary:
Provide a factory for the bulk all request, the first argument is the lazy collection of scroll results which is a mandatory argument to create or
Note that is always overriden as well as

member.name: P:Nest.IReindexRequest`2.CreateIndexRequest
member.summary: Describe how the newly created index should be created. Remember you can also register Index Templates for more dynamic usecases.

member.name: P:Nest.IReindexRequest`2.OmitIndexCreation
member.summary: Do not send a create index call on the target index, assume the index has been created outside of the reindex. Reindex will never create the index if it already exists however this will also omit the IndexExists call.

member.name: P:Nest.IReindexRequest`2.ScrollAll
member.summary:

member.name: P:Nest.ReindexRequest`2.BackPressureFactor
member.summary:
The scroll typically outperforms the bulk operations by a long shot. If we'd leave things unbounded you'd quickly have way too many pending scroll requests. What this property allows you to express is that for each bucket in the max concurrency of the minimum max concurrency between producer and consumer amply the maximum overal pending of the other side by this factor. Typically the concurrency of the consumer (bulkall) will be lower and with this factor we can dampen the overall pending scroll requests while we are still processing bulk requests.
defaults to 4 if not provided

member.name: P:Nest.ReindexRequest`2.OmitIndexCreation
member.summary: Do not send a create index call on the target index, assume the index has been created outside of the reindex. Reindex will never create the index if it already exists however this will also omit the IndexExists call.

member.name: P:Nest.IScrollAllRequest.BackPressure
member.summary: Simple back pressure implementation that makes sure the minimum max concurrency between producer and consumer is not amplified by the greedier of the two by more then a given back pressure factor When set each scroll request will additionally wait on as well as if set. Not that the consumer has to call on the same instance every time it is done.

member.summary: Maximum number of terms that must be returned per field. Defaults to 25.

member.name: P:Nest.UpdateRequest`2.Refresh
member.summary: If `true` then refresh the effected shards to make this operation visible to search, if `wait_for` then wait for a refresh to make this operation visible to search, if `false` (the default) then do nothing with refreshes.

member.name: P:Nest.UpdateRequest`2.RetryOnConflict
member.summary: Specify how many times should the operation be retried when a conflict occurs (default: 0)

member.name: P:Nest.UpdateRequest`2.SourceEnabled
member.summary: Whether the _source should be included in the response.

member.name: P:Nest.UpdateRequest`2.Timeout
member.summary: Explicit operation timeout

member.name: P:Nest.UpdateRequest`2.WaitForActiveShards
member.summary: Sets the number of shard copies that must be active before proceeding with the update operation. Defaults to 1, meaning the primary shard only. Set to `all` for all shard copies, otherwise set to any non-negative value less than or equal to the total number of copies for the shard (number of replicas + 1)

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.ExpungeDeletesAllowed
member.summary: When expungeDeletes is called, we only merge away a segment if its delete percentage is over this threshold. Default is 10.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.FloorSegment
member.summary: Segments smaller than this are "rounded up" to this size, i.e. treated as equal (floor) size for merge selection. This is to prevent frequent flushing of tiny segments, thus preventing a long tail in the index. Default is 2mb.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.MaxMergeAtOnce
member.summary: Maximum number of segments to be merged at a time during "normal" merging. Default is 10.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.MaxMergeAtOnceExplicit
member.summary: Maximum number of segments to be merged at a time, during optimize or expungeDeletes. Default is 30.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.MaxMergedSegment
member.summary: Maximum sized segment to produce during normal merging (not explicit optimize). This setting is approximate: the estimate of the merged segment size is made by summing sizes of to-be-merged segments (compensating for percent deleted docs). Default is 5gb.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.ReclaimDeletesWeight
member.summary: Controls how aggressively merges that reclaim more deletions are favored. Higher values favor selecting merges that reclaim deletions. A value of 0.0 means deletions don’t impact merge selection. Defaults to 2.0

member.name: P:Nest.IMergePolicySettings.SegmentsPerTier
member.summary: Sets the allowed number of segments per tier. Smaller values mean more merging but fewer segments. Default is 10. Note, this value needs to be >= than the max_merge_at_once otherwise you’ll force too many merges to occur.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergeSchedulerSettings.AutoThrottle
member.summary: If this is true (the default), then the merge scheduler will rate-limit IO (writes) for merges to an adaptive value depending on how many merges are requested over time. An application with a low indexing rate that unluckily suddenly requires a large merge will see that merge aggressively throttled, while an application doing heavy indexing will see the throttle move higher to allow merges to keep up with ongoing indexing.

member.name: P:Nest.IMergeSchedulerSettings.MaxThreadCount
member.summary: The maximum number of threads that may be merging at once. Defaults to Math.max(1, Math.min(4, Runtime.getRuntime().availableProcessors() / 2)) which works well for a good solid-state-disk (SSD). If your index is on spinning platter drives instead, decrease this to 1.

member.name: P:Nest.MergeSchedulerSettings.AutoThrottle
member.summary: If this is true (the default), then the merge scheduler will rate-limit IO (writes) for merges to an adaptive value depending on how many merges are requested over time. An application with a low indexing rate that unluckily suddenly requires a large merge will see that merge aggressively throttled, while an application doing heavy indexing will see the throttle move higher to allow merges to keep up with ongoing indexing.

member.name: T:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings
member.summary: Dynamic index settings

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.Analysis
member.summary: Configure analysis

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.AutoExpandReplicas
member.summary: Auto-expand the number of replicas based on the number of available nodes. Set to a dash delimited lower and upper bound (e.g. 0-5) or use all for the upper bound (e.g. 0-all). Defaults to false (i.e. disabled).

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksMetadata
member.summary: Set to true to disable index metadata reads and writes.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksRead
member.summary: Set to true to disable read operations against the index.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksReadOnly
member.summary: Set to true to make the index and index metadata read only, false to allow writes and metadata changes.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.BlocksWrite
member.summary: Set to true to disable write operations against the index.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.Merge
member.summary: All of the settings exposed in the merge module are expert only and may be obsoleted in the future at any time!

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.NumberOfReplicas
member.summary: The number of replicas each primary shard has. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.Priority
member.summary: Unallocated shards are recovered in order of priority when set

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.RecoveryInitialShards
member.summary: A primary shard is only recovered only if there are enough nodes available to allocate sufficient replicas to form a quorum.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.RefreshInterval
member.summary: How often to perform a refresh operation, which makes recent changes to the index visible to search. Defaults to 1s. Can be set to -1 to disable refresh.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.RequestsCacheEnabled
member.summary: Enables the shard-level request cache. Not enabled by default.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.RoutingAllocationTotalShardsPerNode
member.summary: The maximum number of shards (replicas and primaries) that will be allocated to a single node. Defaults to unbounded.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.Similarity
member.summary: Configure similarity

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.SlowLog
member.summary: Configure logging thresholds and levels in Elasticsearch for search/fetch and indexing

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.Translog
member.summary: Configure translog settings. This should only be used by experts who know what they're doing

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.UnassignedNodeLeftDelayedTimeout
member.summary: The allocation of replica shards which become unassigned because a node has left can be delayed with this dynamic setting, which defaults to 1m.

member.name: P:Nest.IDynamicIndexSettings.DefaultPipeline
member.summary: The default ingest node pipeline for this index. Index requests will fail if the default pipeline is set and the pipeline does not exist. The default may be overridden using the pipeline parameter. The special pipeline name _none indicates no ingest pipeline should be run.`

member.name: T:Nest.FileSystemStorageImplementation
member.summary: The store module allows you to control how index data is stored and accessed on disk.

member.name: F:Nest.FileSystemStorageImplementation.Simple
member.summary: The Simple FS type is a straightforward implementation of file system storage (maps to Lucene SimpleFsDirectory) using a random access file. This implementation has poor concurrent performance (multiple threads will bottleneck). It is usually better to use the niofs when you need index persistence.

member.name: F:Nest.FileSystemStorageImplementation.NIO
member.summary: The NIO FS type stores the shard index on the file system (maps to Lucene NIOFSDirectory) using NIO. It allows multiple threads to read from the same file concurrently. It is not recommended on Windows because of a bug in the SUN Java implementation.

member.name: F:Nest.FileSystemStorageImplementation.MMap
member.summary: The MMap FS type stores the shard index on the file system (maps to Lucene MMapDirectory) by mapping a file into memory (mmap). Memory mapping uses up a portion of the virtual memory address space in your process equal to the size of the file being mapped. Before using this class, be sure you have allowed plenty of virtual address space.

member.name: F:Nest.FileSystemStorageImplementation.Default
member.summary: The default type is a hybrid of NIO FS and MMapFS, which chooses the best file system for each type of file. Currently only the Lucene term dictionary and doc values files are memory mapped to reduce the impact on the operating system. All other files are opened using Lucene NIOFSDirectory.

member.name: P:Nest.ITranslogFlushSettings.Interval
member.summary: How often to check if a flush is needed, randomized between the interval value and 2x the interval value. Defaults to 5s.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRAfterEffect.No
member.summary: Implementation used when there is no aftereffect.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRAfterEffect.B
member.summary: Model of the information gain based on the ratio of two Bernoulli processes.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRAfterEffect.L
member.summary: Model of the information gain based on Laplace's law of succession.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.BE
member.summary: Limiting form of the Bose-Einstein model. The formula used in Lucene differs slightly from the one in the original paper: F is increased by tfn+1 and N is increased by F

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.D
member.summary: Implements the approximation of the binomial model with the divergence for DFR. The formula used in Lucene differs slightly from the one in the original paper: to avoid underflow for small values of N and F, N is increased by 1 and F is always increased by tfn+1.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.G
member.summary: Geometric as limiting form of the Bose-Einstein model. The formula used in Lucene differs slightly from the one in the original paper: F is increased by 1 and N is increased by F.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.IF
member.summary: An approximation of the I(ne) model.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.IN
member.summary: The basic tf-idf model of randomness.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.INE
member.summary: Tf-idf model of randomness, based on a mixture of Poisson and inverse document frequency.

member.name: F:Nest.DFRBasicModel.P
member.summary: Implements the Poisson approximation for the binomial model for DFR.

member.name: T:Nest.IDFRSimilarity
member.summary: Implements the divergence from randomness (DFR) framework introduced in Gianni Amati and Cornelis Joost Van Rijsbergen. 2002. Probabilistic models of information retrieval based on measuring the divergence from randomness. ACM Trans. Inf. Syst. 20, 4 (October 2002), 357-389. The DFR scoring formula is composed of three separate components: the basic model, the aftereffect and an additional normalization component, represented by the classes BasicModel, AfterEffect and Normalization, respectively.The names of these classes were chosen to match the names of their counterparts in the Terrier IR engine.

member.name: P:Nest.IDFRSimilarity.AfterEffect
member.summary: The after effect

member.summary: The normalization

member.summary: Normalization model that assumes a uniform distribution of the term frequency.

member.name: P:Nest.IDFRSimilarity.NormalizationH2C
member.summary: Normalization model in which the term frequency is inversely related to the length.

member.name: P:Nest.IDFRSimilarity.NormalizationH3C
member.summary: Dirichlet Priors normalization

member.name: P:Nest.IDFRSimilarity.NormalizationZZ
member.summary: Pareto-Zipf Normalization

member.name: T:Nest.IIBSimilarity
member.summary: Information based model similarity. The algorithm is based on the concept that the information content in any symbolic distribution sequence is primarily determined by the repetitive usage of its basic elements. For written texts this challenge would correspond to comparing the writing styles of different authors.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.Filter
member.summary: Provides an easy way to create different "views" of the same index. A filter can be defined using Query DSL and is applied to all Search, Count, Delete By Query and More Like This operations with this alias.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.IndexRouting
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for index operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.Routing
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for both index and search operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.name: P:Nest.IAlias.SearchRouting
member.summary: Associates routing values with aliases for search operations. This feature can be used together with filtering aliases in order to avoid unnecessary shard operations.

member.summary: Token filters that allow to decompose compound words using FOP XML

member.summary: A token filter of type edgeNGram.

member.summary: The phonetic token filter is provided as a plugin.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Shingle(System.Func{Nest.ShingleTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IShingleTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type shingle that constructs shingles (token n-grams) from a token stream.
In other words, it creates combinations of tokens as a single token.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Stop(System.Func{Nest.StopTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStopTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type stop that removes stop words from token streams.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Synonym(System.Func{Nest.SynonymTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ISynonymTokenFilter})
member.summary: The synonym token filter allows to easily handle synonyms during the analysis process.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.SynonymGraph(System.Func{Nest.SynonymGraphTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ISynonymGraphTokenFilter})
member.summary: The synonym_graph token filter allows to easily handle synonyms, including multi-word synonyms correctly during the analysis process.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.WordDelimiter(System.Func{Nest.WordDelimiterTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IWordDelimiterTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.WordDelimiterGraph(System.Func{Nest.WordDelimiterGraphTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IWordDelimiterGraphTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.AsciiFolding(System.Func{Nest.AsciiFoldingTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IAsciiFoldingTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.CommonGrams(System.Func{Nest.CommonGramsTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ICommonGramsTokenFilter})
member.summary:
Token filter that generates bigrams for frequently occuring terms. Single terms are still indexed.
Note, common_words or common_words_path field is required.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.DelimitedPayload(System.Func{Nest.DelimitedPayloadTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IDelimitedPayloadTokenFilter})
member.summary: Splits tokens into tokens and payload whenever a delimiter character is found.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Elision(System.Func{Nest.ElisionTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IElisionTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter which removes elisions. For example, “l’avion” (the plane) will tokenized as “avion” (plane).

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Hunspell(System.Func{Nest.HunspellTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IHunspellTokenFilter})
member.summary:
Basic support for hunspell stemming.
Hunspell dictionaries will be picked up from a dedicated hunspell directory on the filesystem.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeepTypes(System.Func{Nest.KeepTypesTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKeepTypesTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeepWords(System.Func{Nest.KeepWordsTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKeepWordsTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KeywordMarker(System.Func{Nest.KeywordMarkerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKeywordMarkerTokenFilter})
member.summary: Protects words from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KStem(System.Func{Nest.KStemTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKStemTokenFilter})
member.summary:
The kstem token filter is a high performance filter for english.
All terms must already be lowercased (use lowercase filter) for this filter to work correctly.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Length(System.Func{Nest.LengthTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ILengthTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type length that removes words that are too long or too short for the stream.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.LimitTokenCount(System.Func{Nest.LimitTokenCountTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ILimitTokenCountTokenFilter})
member.summary: Limits the number of tokens that are indexed per document and field.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Lowercase(System.Func{Nest.LowercaseTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ILowercaseTokenFilter})
member.summary:
A token filter of type lowercase that normalizes token text to lower case.
Lowercase token filter supports Greek and Turkish lowercase token filters through the language parameter.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.NGram(System.Func{Nest.NGramTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.INGramTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type nGram.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PatternCapture(System.Func{Nest.PatternCaptureTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IPatternCaptureTokenFilter})
member.summary: The pattern_capture token filter, unlike the pattern tokenizer, emits a token for every capture group in the regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PatternReplace(System.Func{Nest.PatternReplaceTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IPatternReplaceTokenFilter})
member.summary: The pattern_replace token filter allows to easily handle string replacements based on a regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.PorterStem(System.Func{Nest.PorterStemTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IPorterStemTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type porterStem that transforms the token stream as per the Porter stemming algorithm.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Reverse(System.Func{Nest.ReverseTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IReverseTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type reverse that simply reverses the tokens.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Snowball(System.Func{Nest.SnowballTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ISnowballTokenFilter})
member.summary: A filter that stems words using a Snowball-generated stemmer.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Stemmer(System.Func{Nest.StemmerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStemmerTokenFilter})
member.summary: A filter that stems words (similar to snowball, but with more options).

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.StemmerOverride(System.Func{Nest.StemmerOverrideTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IStemmerOverrideTokenFilter})
member.summary: Overrides stemming algorithms, by applying a custom mapping, then protecting these terms from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Trim(System.Func{Nest.TrimTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ITrimTokenFilter})
member.summary: The trim token filter trims surrounding whitespaces around a token.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Truncate(System.Func{Nest.TruncateTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.ITruncateTokenFilter})
member.summary:
The truncate token filter can be used to truncate tokens into a specific length. This can come in handy with keyword (single token)
based mapped fields that are used for sorting in order to reduce memory usage.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Unique(System.Func{Nest.UniqueTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IUniqueTokenFilter})
member.summary: The unique token filter can be used to only index unique tokens during analysis. By default it is applied on all the token stream

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Uppercase(System.Func{Nest.UppercaseTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IUppercaseTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type uppercase that normalizes token text to upper case.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.Fingerprint(System.Func{Nest.FingerprintTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IFingerprintTokenFilter})
member.summary: A token filter of type fingerprint The fingerprint token filter that emits a single token which is useful for fingerprinting a body of text, and/or providing a token that can be clustered on. It does this by sorting the tokens, deduplicating and then concatenating them back into a single token.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiStemmer(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiStemmerTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiStemmerTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_stemmer token filter normalizes common katakana spelling variations ending in a long sound character by removing this character (U+30FC). Only full-width katakana characters are supported. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiReadingForm(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiReadingFormTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiReadingFormTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_readingform token filter replaces the token with its reading form in either katakana or romaji. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.KuromojiPartOfSpeech(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiPartOfSpeechTokenFilter})
member.summary: The kuromoji_part_of_speech token filter removes tokens that match a set of part-of-speech tags. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuCollation(System.Func{Nest.IcuCollationTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuCollationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Collations are used for sorting documents in a language-specific word order. The icu_collation token filter is available to all indices and defaults to using the DUCET collation, which is a best-effort attempt at language-neutral sorting. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuFolding(System.Func{Nest.IcuFoldingTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuFoldingTokenFilter})
member.summary: Case folding of Unicode characters based on UTR#30, like the ASCII-folding token filter on steroids. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuNormalization(System.Func{Nest.IcuNormalizationTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuNormalizationTokenFilter})
member.summary: Normalizes as defined here: http://userguide.icu-project.org/transforms/normalization Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenFiltersDescriptor.IcuTransform(System.Func{Nest.IcuTransformTokenFilterDescriptor,Nest.IIcuTransformTokenFilter})
member.summary: Transforms are used to process Unicode text in many different ways, such as case mapping, normalization, transliteration and bidirectional text handling. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.EdgeNGram(System.Func{Nest.EdgeNGramTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IEdgeNGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type edgeNGram.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.NGram(System.Func{Nest.NGramTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.INGramTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type nGram.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Keyword(System.Func{Nest.KeywordTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IKeywordTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Letter(System.Func{Nest.LetterTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.ILetterTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. That’s to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Lowercase(System.Func{Nest.LowercaseTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.ILowercaseTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.PathHierarchy(System.Func{Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IPathHierarchyTokenizer})
member.summary:
The path_hierarchy tokenizer takes something like this:
/something/something/else
And produces tokens:
/something
/something/something
/something/something/else

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Pattern(System.Func{Nest.PatternTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IPatternTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Standard(System.Func{Nest.StandardTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IStandardTokenizer})
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type standard providing grammar based tokenizer that is a good tokenizer for most European language documents.
The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.UaxEmailUrl(System.Func{Nest.UaxEmailUrlTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IUaxEmailUrlTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type uax_url_email which works exactly like the standard tokenizer, but tokenizes emails and urls as single tokens

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Whitespace(System.Func{Nest.WhitespaceTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IWhitespaceTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type whitespace that divides text at whitespace.

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Kuromoji(System.Func{Nest.KuromojiTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IKuromojiTokenizer})
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression. Part of the `analysis-kuromoji` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-kuromoji.html

member.name: M:Nest.AnalyzeTokenizersSelector.Icu(System.Func{Nest.IcuTokenizerDescriptor,Nest.IIcuTokenizer})
member.summary: Tokenizes text into words on word boundaries, as defined in UAX #29: Unicode Text Segmentation. It behaves much like the standard tokenizer, but adds better support for some Asian languages by using a dictionary-based approach to identify words in Thai, Lao, Chinese, Japanese, and Korean, and using custom rules to break Myanmar and Khmer text into syllables. Part of the `analysis-icu` plugin: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/plugins/current/analysis-icu.html

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Attachment``1(System.Func{Nest.AttachmentProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IAttachmentProcessor})
member.summary: The ingest attachment plugin lets Elasticsearch extract file attachments in common formats (such as PPT, XLS, and PDF) by using the Apache text extraction library Tika. You can use the ingest attachment plugin as a replacement for the mapper attachment plugin.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.GeoIp``1(System.Func{Nest.GeoIpProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IGeoIpProcessor})
member.summary: Adds information about the geographical location of IP addresses, based on data from the Maxmind databases. This processor adds this information by default under the geoip field. The geoip processor can resolve both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.
member.remarks: Requires the Ingest Geoip Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Sort``1(System.Func{Nest.SortProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.ISortProcessor})
member.summary: The Sort processor sorts the elements of an array ascending or descending. Homogeneous arrays of numbers will be sorted numerically, while arrays of strings or heterogeneous arrays of strings and numbers will be sorted lexicographically.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.Json``1(System.Func{Nest.JsonProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IJsonProcessor})
member.summary: Converts a JSON string into a structured JSON object.

member.name: M:Nest.ProcessorsDescriptor.UserAgent``1(System.Func{Nest.UserAgentProcessorDescriptor{``0},Nest.IUserAgentProcessor})
member.summary: The user_agent processor extracts details from the user agent string a browser sends with its web requests. This processor adds this information by default under the user_agent field. The ingest-user-agent plugin ships by default with the regexes.yaml made available by uap-java with an Apache 2.0 license.
member.remarks: Requires the UserAgent Processor Plugin to be installed on the cluster.

member.name: T:Nest.IDissectProcessor
member.summary: Similar to the Grok Processor, dissect also extracts structured fields out of a single text field within a document. However unlike the Grok Processor, dissect does not use Regular Expressions. This allows dissect’s syntax to be simple and, for some cases faster, than the Grok Processor.

member.name: T:Nest.IForeachProcessor
member.summary: Processes elements in an array of unknown length. All processors can operate on elements inside an array, but if all elements of an array need to be processed in the same way, defining a processor for each element becomes cumbersome and tricky because it is likely that the number of elements in an array is unknown. For this reason the foreach processor exists. By specifying the field holding array elements and a processor that defines what should happen to each element, array fields can easily be preprocessed.

member.name: P:Nest.IForeachProcessor.Field
member.summary: The array field

member.name: P:Nest.IForeachProcessor.Processor
member.summary: The processor to execute against each field

member.name: P:Nest.IForeachProcessor.IgnoreMissing
member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.summary: The array field

member.summary: The processor to execute against each field
