member.summary: If true and does not exist or is null, the processor quietly exits without modifying the document. Default is false

member.summary: The array field

Only the following datatypes can be automatically detected: boolean, date, double, long, object, string. It also accepts * to match all datatypes.

member.name: T:Nest.Mappings
member.summary:
Types are gone from Elasticsearch 7.x this class solely exist to help you move your complex mappings over to the new way of writing the mappings. Use TypeMapping directly instead.
This class won't receive updates after the 7.0.0 release please be advised to move over if you need to utilize new features in the future.

member.name: T:Nest.PreventMappingMultipleTypesDescriptor
member.summary: The common pattern in NEST is that you can call fluent methods multiple types overriding what was previously set. This type prevents a user to call Map() multiple times with different types making it crystal clear not only can you no longer have multiple types in an index makes the overloads that take type obsolete as well. Both and are obsolete. Please move to

member.summary: A document field mapping in Elasticsearch

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.DateDetection
member.summary: If enabled (default), then new string fields are checked to see whether their contents match any of the date patterns specified in . If a match is found, a new date field is added with the corresponding format.

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.Dynamic
member.summary: Whether new unseen fields will be added to the mapping. Default is true. A value of false will ignore unknown fields and a value of will result in an error if an unknown field is encountered in a document.

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.DynamicDateFormats
member.summary: Date formats used by

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.DynamicTemplates
member.summary:
Dynamic templates allow you to define custom mappings that can be applied to dynamically added fields based on
- the datatype detected by Elasticsearch, with .
- the name of the field, with and or .
- the full dotted path to the field, with and .
The original field name {name} and the detected datatype {dynamic_type} template variables can be used in the mapping specification as placeholders.

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.FieldNamesField
member.summary: Used to index the names of every field in a document that contains any value other than null. This field was used by the exists query to find documents that either have or don’t have any non-null value for a particular field. Now, it only indexes the names of fields that have doc_values and norms disabled. Can be disabled. Disabling _field_names is often not necessary because it no longer carries the index overhead it once did. If you have a lot of fields which have doc_values and norms disabled and you do not need to execute exists queries using those fields you might want to disable

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.Meta
member.summary: Custom meta data to associate with a mapping. Not used by Elasticsearch, but can be used to store application-specific metadata.

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.NumericDetection
member.summary: If enabled (not enabled by default), then new string fields are checked to see whether they wholly contain a numeric value and if so, to map as a numeric field.

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.Properties
member.summary: Specifies the mapping properties

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.RoutingField
member.summary: Specifies configuration for the _routing parameter

member.name: P:Nest.ITypeMapping.SizeField
member.summary: If enabled, indexes the size in bytes of the original _source field. Requires mapper-size plugin be installed

member.name: T:Nest.IFlattenedProperty
member.summary:
By default, each subfield in an object is mapped and indexed separately. If the names or types of the subfields are not known in advance, then they are mapped dynamically. The flattened type provides an alternative approach, where the entire object is mapped as a single field. Given an object, the flattened mapping will parse out its leaf values and index them into one field as keywords. The object's contents can then be searched through simple queries and aggregations.
Available in Elasticsearch 7.3.0+ with at least basic license level

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.Boost
member.summary: Mapping field-level query time boosting. Accepts a floating point number, defaults to 1.0.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.DepthLimit
member.summary: The maximum allowed depth of the flattened object field, in terms of nested inner objects. If a flattened object field exceeds this limit, then an error will be thrown. Defaults to 20.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.DocValues
member.summary: Whether to persist the value at index time in a columnar data structure (referred to as doc_values in Lucene) which makes the value available for efficient sorting and aggregations. Default is true.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.EagerGlobalOrdinals
member.summary: Should global ordinals be loaded eagerly on refresh? Accepts true or false (default). Enabling this is a good idea on fields that are frequently used for terms aggregations.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.IgnoreAbove
member.summary: Leaf values longer than this limit will not be indexed. By default, there is no limit and all values will be indexed. Note that this limit applies to the leaf values within the flattened object field, and not the length of the entire field.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.Index
member.summary: Should the field be searchable? Accepts true (default) and false.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.IndexOptions
member.summary: What information should be stored in the index for scoring purposes. Defaults to docs but can also be set to freqs to take term frequency into account when computing scores.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.NullValue
member.summary: A string value which is substituted for any explicit null values within the flattened object field. Defaults to null, which means null fields are treated as if it were missing.

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.Similarity
member.summary: Which relevancy scoring algorithm or similarity should be used. Defaults to BM25

member.name: P:Nest.IFlattenedProperty.SplitQueriesOnWhitespace
member.summary: Whether full text queries should split the input on whitespace when building a query for this field.

member.name: P:Nest.FlattenedProperty.Boost
member.summary: Mapping field-level query time boosting. Accepts a floating point number, defaults to 1.0.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.DocValues(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Whether to persist the value at index time in a columnar data structure (referred to as doc_values in Lucene) which makes the value available for efficient sorting and aggregations. Default is true.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.EagerGlobalOrdinals(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Should global ordinals be loaded eagerly on refresh? Accepts true or false (default). Enabling this is a good idea on fields that are frequently used for terms aggregations.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.IgnoreAbove(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Leaf values longer than this limit will not be indexed. By default, there is no limit and all values will be indexed. Note that this limit applies to the leaf values within the flattened object field, and not the length of the entire field.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.Index(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Should the field be searchable? Accepts true (default) and false.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.IndexOptions(System.Nullable{Nest.IndexOptions})
member.summary: What information should be stored in the index for scoring purposes. Defaults to docs but can also be set to freqs to take term frequency into account when computing scores.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.NullValue(System.String)
member.summary: A string value which is substituted for any explicit null values within the flattened object field. Defaults to null, which means null fields are treated as if it were missing.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.SplitQueriesOnWhitespace(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Whether full text queries should split the input on whitespace when building a query for this field.

member.name: M:Nest.FlattenedPropertyDescriptor`1.Similarity(System.String)
member.summary: Which relevancy scoring algorithm or similarity should be used. Defaults to BM25

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeaturesProperty
member.summary: A field that can index numeric feature vectors, so that they can later be used to boost documents in queries with a rank_feature query. It is analogous to the datatype, but is better suited when the list of features is sparse so that it wouldn't be reasonable to add one field to the mappings for each of them.

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeatureProperty
member.summary: A field that can index numbers so that they can later be used to boost documents in queries with a rank_feature query.

member.name: P:Nest.IRankFeatureProperty.PositiveScoreImpact
member.summary: Rank features that correlate negatively with the score should set to false (defaults to true). This will be used by the rank_feature query to modify the scoring formula in such a way that the score decreases with the value of the feature instead of increasing. For instance in web search, the url length is a commonly used feature which correlates negatively with scores.

member.name: P:Nest.RankFeatureProperty.PositiveScoreImpact
member.summary: Rank features that correlate negatively with the score should set to false (defaults to true). This will be used by the rank_feature query to modify the scoring formula in such a way that the score decreases with the value of the feature instead of increasing. For instance in web search, the url length is a commonly used feature which correlates negatively with scores.

member.name: M:Nest.RankFeaturePropertyDescriptor`1.PositiveScoreImpact(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})

member.name: T:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty
member.summary:
A text-like field that is optimized to provide out-of-the-box support for the "search as you type" completion use case.
It creates a series of subfields that are analyzed to index terms that can be efficiently matched by a query that partially matches the entire indexed text value. Both prefix completion (i.e matching terms starting at the beginning of the input) and infix completion (i.e. matching terms at any position within the input) are supported.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.Analyzer
member.summary: The analyzer which should be used for analyzed string fields, both at index-time and at search-time (unless overridden by the search_analyzer). Defaults to the default index analyzer, or the standard analyzer.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.Index
member.summary: Should the field be searchable? Accepts true (default) or false.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.IndexOptions
member.summary: What information should be stored in the index, for search and highlighting purposes. Defaults to .

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.MaxShingleSize
member.summary: The largest shingle size to index the input with and create subfields for.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.Norms
member.summary: Whether field-length should be taken into account when scoring queries. Accepts true or false. This option configures the root field and shingle subfields, where its default is true. It does not configure the prefix subfield, where it it false.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.SearchAnalyzer
member.summary: The analyzer that should be used at search time on analyzed fields. Defaults to the analyzer setting.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.SearchQuoteAnalyzer
member.summary: The analyzer that should be used at search time when a phrase is encountered. Defaults to the search_analyzer setting.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchAsYouTypeProperty.TermVector
member.summary: Whether term vectors should be stored for an analyzed field. Defaults to no. This option configures the root field and shingle subfields, but not the prefix subfield.

member.summary: If true, malformed geo-points are ignored. If false (default), malformed geo-points throw an exception and reject the whole document.

member.name: P:Nest.IGeoPointProperty.IgnoreZValue
member.summary: If true (default) three dimension points will be accepted (stored in source) but only latitude and longitude values will be indexed; the third dimension is ignored. If false, geo-points containing any more than latitude and longitude (two dimensions) values throw an exception and reject the whole document.

member.name: T:Nest.IClusterModuleSettings
member.summary: Settings to control where, when, and how shards are allocated to nodes.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.HighWatermark
member.summary: Controls the high watermark. It defaults to 90%, meaning ES will attempt to relocate shards to another node if the node disk usage rises above 90%. It can also be set to an absolute byte value (similar to the low watermark) to relocate shards once less than the configured amount of space is available on the node.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.IncludeRelocations
member.summary: Defaults to true, which means that Elasticsearch will take into account shards that are currently being relocated to the target node when computing a node’s disk usage. Taking relocating shards' sizes into account may, however, mean that the disk usage for a node is incorrectly estimated on the high side, since the relocation could be 90% complete and a recently retrieved disk usage would include the total size of the relocating shard as well as the space already used by the running relocation.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.LowWatermark
member.summary: Controls the low watermark for disk usage. It defaults to 85%, meaning ES will not allocate new shards to nodes once they have more than 85% disk used. It can also be set to an absolute byte value (like 500mb) to prevent ES from allocating shards if less than the configured amount of space is available.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.ThresholdEnabled
member.summary: Defaults to true. Set to false to disable the disk allocation decider.

member.name: P:Nest.IDiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.UpdateInterval
member.summary: How often Elasticsearch should check on disk usage for each node in the cluster. Defaults to 30s.

member.name: P:Nest.DiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.HighWatermark
member.summary: Controls the high watermark. It defaults to 90%, meaning ES will attempt to relocate shards to another node if the node disk usage rises above 90%. It can also be set to an absolute byte value (similar to the low watermark) to relocate shards once less than the configured amount of space is available on the node.

member.name: P:Nest.DiskBasedShardAllocationSettings.IncludeRelocations
member.summary: Defaults to true, which means that Elasticsearch will take into account shards that are currently being relocated to the target node when computing a node’s disk usage. Taking relocating shards' sizes into account may, however, mean that the disk usage for a node is incorrectly estimated on the high side, since the relocation could be 90% complete and a recently retrieved disk usage would include the total size of the relocating shard as well as the space already used by the running relocation.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.AllocationEnable
member.summary: Enable or disable allocation for specific kinds of shards, defaults to all

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.NodeConcurrentRecoveries
member.summary: How many concurrent shard recoveries are allowed to happen on a node. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.NodeInitialPrimariesRecoveries
member.summary: While the recovery of replicas happens over the network, the recovery of an unassigned primary after node restart uses data from the local disk. These should be fast so more initial primary recoveries can happen in parallel on the same node. Defaults to 4.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardAllocationSettings.SameShardHost
member.summary: Allows to perform a check to prevent allocation of multiple instances of the same shard on a single host, based on host name and host address. Defaults to false, meaning that no check is performed by default. This setting only applies if multiple nodes are started on the same machine.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceIndex
member.summary: Defines a factor to the number of shards per index allocated on a specific node (float). Defaults to 0.55f. Raising this raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards per index across all nodes in the cluster.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceShard
member.summary: Defines the weight factor for shards allocated on a node (float). Defaults to 0.45f. Raising this raises the tendency to equalize the number of shards across all nodes in the cluster.

member.name: P:Nest.IShardBalancingHeuristicsSettings.BalanceThreshold
member.summary: Minimal optimization value of operations that should be performed (non negative float). Defaults to 1.0f. Raising this will cause the cluster to be less aggressive about optimizing the shard balance

member.name: T:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings
member.summary:
The indexing buffer is used to store newly indexed documents. When it fills up, the documents in the buffer are written to a segment on disk. It is divided between all shards on the node.
The following settings are static and must be configured on every data node in the cluster

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.IndexBufferSize
member.summary: Accepts either a percentage or a byte size value. It defaults to 10%, meaning that 10% of the total heap allocated to a node will be used as the indexing buffer size.

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.IndexBufferSizeMaximum
member.summary: If the index_buffer_size is specified as a percentage, then this setting can be used to specify an absolute maximum. Defaults to unbounded.

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.IndexBufferSizeMinimum
member.summary: If the index_buffer_size is specified as a percentage, then this setting can be used to specify an absolute minimum. Defaults to 48mb.

member.name: P:Nest.IndexingBufferSettings.ShardBufferSizeMinimum
member.summary: Sets a hard lower limit for the memory allocated per shard for its own indexing buffer. Defaults to 4mb.

member.name: T:Nest.IS3Repository
member.summary:
A snapshot repository that stores snapshots in an Amazon S3 bucket
Requires the repository-s3 plugin to be installed on the cluster

member.name: T:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings
member.summary: Snapshot repository settings for

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.BasePath
member.summary: Specifies the path within bucket to repository data. Defaults to value of repositories.s3.base_path or to root directory if not set.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.Bucket
member.summary: The name of the bucket to be used for snapshots. This field is required

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.BufferSize
member.summary: Minimum threshold below which the chunk is uploaded using a single request. Beyond this threshold, the S3 repository will use the AWS Multipart Upload API to split the chunk into several parts, each of buffer_size length, and to upload each part in its own request. Note that setting a buffer size lower than 5mb is not allowed since it will prevent the use of the Multipart API and may result in upload errors. It is also not possible to set a buffer size greater than 5gb as it is the maximum upload size allowed by S3. Defaults to the minimum between 100mb and 5% of the heap size.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.CannedAcl
member.summary: Specify a canned ACL for the S3 bucket. The S3 repository supports all S3 canned ACLs : private, public-read, public-read-write, authenticated-read, log-delivery-write, bucket-owner-read, bucket-owner-full-control. Defaults to private.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.ChunkSize
member.summary: Big files can be broken down into chunks during snapshotting if needed. The chunk size can be specified in bytes or by using size value notation, i.e. 1gb, 10mb, 5kb. Defaults to 1gb.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.Client
member.summary: The name of the s3 client to use to connect to S3. Defaults to default.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.Compress
member.summary: When set to true metadata files are stored in compressed format. This setting doesn't affect index files that are already compressed by default. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.ServerSideEncryption
member.summary: When set to true files are encrypted on server side using AES256 algorithm. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.StorageClass
member.summary: Sets the S3 storage class type for the backup files. Values may be standard, reduced_redundancy, standard_ia. Defaults to standard.

member.name: P:Nest.IS3RepositorySettings.DisableChunkedEncoding
member.summary: Whether chunked encoding should be disabled or not. If false, chunked encoding is enabled and will be used where appropriate. If true, chunked encoding is disabled and will not be used, which may mean that snapshot operations consume more resources and take longer to complete. It should only be set to true if you are using a storage service that does not support chunked encoding. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.S3RepositorySettings.BasePath
member.summary: Specifies the path within bucket to repository data. Defaults to value of repositories.s3.base_path or to root directory if not set.

member.name: P:Nest.S3RepositorySettings.Bucket
member.summary: The name of the bucket to be used for snapshots. This field is required

member.name: P:Nest.S3RepositorySettings.BufferSize
member.summary: Minimum threshold below which the chunk is uploaded using a single request. Beyond this threshold, the S3 repository will use the AWS Multipart Upload API to split the chunk into several parts, each of buffer_size length, and to upload each part in its own request. Note that setting a buffer size lower than 5mb is not allowed since it will prevent the use of the Multipart API and may result in upload errors. It is also not possible to set a buffer size greater than 5gb as it is the maximum upload size allowed by S3. Defaults to the minimum between 100mb and 5% of the heap size.

member.name: P:Nest.S3RepositorySettings.CannedAcl

member.name: T:Nest.ISourceOnlyRepository
member.summary: A source repository enables you to create minimal, source-only snapshots that take up to 50% less space on disk. Source only snapshots contain stored fields and index metadata. They do not include index or doc values structures and are not searchable when restored. After restoring a source-only snapshot, you must reindex the data into a new index.

member.summary: The indices to restore

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.Partial
member.summary:
Allow partial restore for indices that don't have snapshots of all shards available.
By default, the entire restore operation will fail if one or more indices participating in the operation don’t have snapshots of all shards available. It can occur if some shards failed to snapshot for example. It is still possible to restore such indices by setting to true. Only successfully snapshotted shards will be restored in this case and all missing shards will be recreated empty.

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.RenamePattern
member.summary: A pattern to use to rename restored indices. The pattern can be used to capture parts of the original index name and used within

member.name: P:Nest.IRestoreRequest.RenameReplacement
member.summary: A replacement to use to rename restored indices. Used in conjunction with .

member.summary: The multi_match query builds further on top of the match query by allowing multiple fields to be specified. member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Wildcard``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,``0}},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Double},Nest.MultiTermQueryRewrite,System.String)
member.summary: Matches documents that have fields matching a wildcard expression (not analyzed). Supported wildcards are *, which matches any character sequence (including the empty one), and ?, which matches any single character. Note this query can be slow, as it needs to iterate over many terms. In order to prevent extremely slow wildcard queries, a wildcard term should not start with one of the wildcards * or ?. The wildcard query maps to Lucene WildcardQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Ids(System.Func{Nest.IdsQueryDescriptor,Nest.IIdsQuery})
member.summary: Matches documents that only have the provided ids. Note, this filter does not require the _id field to be indexed since it works using the _uid field.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Intervals(System.Func{Nest.IntervalsQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IIntervalsQuery})
member.summary: Allows fine-grained control over the order and proximity of matching terms. Matching rules are constructed from a small set of definitions, and the rules are then applied to terms from a particular field. The definitions produce sequences of minimal intervals that span terms in a body of text. These intervals can be further combined and filtered by parent sources.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanTerm(System.Func{Nest.SpanTermQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanTermQuery})
member.summary: Matches spans containing a term. The span term query maps to Lucene SpanTermQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanFirst(System.Func{Nest.SpanFirstQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanFirstQuery})
member.summary: Matches spans near the beginning of a field. The span first query maps to Lucene SpanFirstQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanNear(System.Func{Nest.SpanNearQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanNearQuery})
member.summary: Matches spans which are near one another. One can specify slop, the maximum number of intervening unmatched positions, as well as whether matches are required to be in-order. The span near query maps to Lucene SpanNearQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanOr(System.Func{Nest.SpanOrQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanOrQuery})
member.summary: Matches the union of its span clauses. The span or query maps to Lucene SpanOrQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanNot(System.Func{Nest.SpanNotQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanNotQuery})
member.summary: Removes matches which overlap with another span query. The span not query maps to Lucene SpanNotQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanMultiTerm(System.Func{Nest.SpanMultiTermQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanMultiTermQuery})
member.summary: Wrap a multi term query (one of fuzzy, prefix, term range or regexp query) as a span query so it can be nested.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanContaining(System.Func{Nest.SpanContainingQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanContainingQuery})
member.summary: Returns matches which enclose another span query. The span containing query maps to Lucene SpanContainingQuery

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanWithin(System.Func{Nest.SpanWithinQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanWithinQuery})
member.summary: Returns Matches which are enclosed inside another span query. The span within query maps to Lucene SpanWithinQuery

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.SpanFieldMasking(System.Func{Nest.SpanFieldMaskingQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ISpanFieldMaskingQuery})
member.summary: Wraps span queries to allow them to participate in composite single-field Span queries by 'lying' about their search field. That is, the masked span query will function as normal, but the field points back to the set field of the query. This can be used to support queries like SpanNearQuery or SpanOrQuery across different fields, which is not ordinarily permitted.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Regexp(System.Func{Nest.RegexpQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IRegexpQuery})
member.summary: Allows you to use regular expression term queries. "term queries" means that Elasticsearch will apply the regexp to the terms produced by the tokenizer for that field, and not to the original text of the field.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.FunctionScore(System.Func{Nest.FunctionScoreQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IFunctionScoreQuery})
member.summary: The function_score query allows you to modify the score of documents that are retrieved by a query. This can be useful if, for example, a score function is computationally expensive and it is sufficient to compute the score on a filtered set of documents.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.Percolate(System.Func{Nest.PercolateQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IPercolateQuery})
member.summary: Used to match queries stored in an index. The percolate query itself contains the document that will be used as query to match with the stored queries.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.ParentId(System.Func{Nest.ParentIdQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.IParentIdQuery})
member.summary: Used to find child documents which belong to a particular parent.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryContainerDescriptor`1.TermsSet(System.Func{Nest.TermsSetQueryDescriptor{`0},Nest.ITermsSetQuery})
member.summary: Returns any documents that match with at least one or more of the provided terms. The terms are not analyzed and thus must match exactly. The number of terms that must match varies per document and is either controlled by a minimum should match field or computed per document in a minimum should match script.

member.name: M:Nest.BoolQueryAndExtensions.TryHandleUnmergableBools(Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.QueryContainer@)
member.summary: Handles cases where either side is a bool which indicates it can't be merged yet the other side is mergable. A side is considered unmergable if its locked (has important metadata) or has should clauses. Instead of always wrapping these cases in another bool we merge to unmergable side into to others must clause therefor flattening the generated graph

member.name: M:Nest.BoolQueryAndExtensions.TryHandleBoolsWithOnlyShouldClauses(Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.QueryContainer,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.IBoolQuery,Nest.QueryContainer@)
member.summary: Both Sides are bools, but one of them has only should clauses so we should wrap into a new container. Unless we know one of the sides is a bool with only a must who's clauses are all bools with only shoulds. This is a piece of metadata we set at the bools creation time so we do not have to itterate the clauses on each combination In this case we can optimize the generated graph by merging and preventing stack overflows

member.name: P:Nest.IQuery.Boost
member.summary: Provides a boost to this query to influence its relevance score. For example, a query with a boost of 2 is twice as important as a query with a boost of 1, although the actual boost value that is applied undergoes normalization and internal optimization.
member.remarks: Setting a boost for an query will throw a parsing exception on the server.

member.name: T:Nest.IIntervalsPrefix
member.summary:
Matches terms that start with a specified set of characters. This prefix can expand to match at most 128 terms. If the prefix matches more than 128 terms, Elasticsearch returns an error. You can use the index-prefixes option in the field mapping to avoid this limit.
Available in Elasticsearch 7.3.0+

member.summary: Analyzer used to normalize the prefix. Defaults to the top-level field's analyzer.

member.summary: Beginning characters of terms you wish to find in the top-level field

member.summary: If specified, then match intervals from this field rather than the top-level field. The prefix is normalized using the search analyzer from this field, unless a separate analyzer is specified.

member.name: T:Nest.IIntervalsQuery
member.summary: A query that allows fine-grained control over the order and proximity of matching terms. Matching rules are constructed from a small set of definitions, and the rules are then applied to terms from a particular field. The definitions produce sequences of minimal intervals that span terms in a body of text. These intervals can be further combined and filtered by parent sources.

member.name: T:Nest.IIntervalsWildcard
member.summary:
Matches terms using a wildcard pattern. This pattern can expand to match at most 128 terms. If the pattern matches more than 128 terms, Elasticsearch returns an error.
Available in Elasticsearch 7.3.0+

member.name: P:Nest.IIntervalsWildcard.Analyzer
member.summary: Analyzer used to normalize the prefix. Defaults to the top-level field's analyzer.

member.name: P:Nest.IIntervalsWildcard.Pattern
member.summary:
Wildcard pattern used to find matching terms. Supports two wildcard operators:
?, which matches any single character
*, which can match zero or more characters, including an empty one
Warning: Avoid beginning patterns with * or ?. This can increase the iterations needed to find matching terms and slow search performance.

member.name: P:Nest.IIntervalsWildcard.UseField
member.summary: If specified, then match intervals from this field rather than the top-level field. The prefix is normalized using the search analyzer from this field, unless a separate analyzer is specified.

member.summary: The analyzer name used to analyze the query

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.CutoffFrequency
member.summary: A cutoff frequency that allows specifying an absolute or relative document frequency where high frequency terms are moved into an optional subquery and are only scored if one of the low frequency (below the cutoff) terms in the case of , or all of the low frequency terms in the case of an match.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Fuzziness
member.summary: Allows fuzzy matching based on the type of field being queried.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.FuzzyRewrite
member.summary: Controls how the query is rewritten if is set. In this scenario, the default is .

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.FuzzyTranspositions
member.summary:
Sets whether transpositions are supported in fuzzy queries.
The default metric used by fuzzy queries to determine a match is the Damerau-Levenshtein distance formula which supports transpositions. Setting transposition to false will switch to classic Levenshtein distance. If not set, Damerau-Levenshtein distance metric will be used.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Lenient
member.summary: If set to true will cause format based failures (like providing text to a numeric field) to be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.MaxExpansions
member.summary: Controls the number of terms fuzzy queries will expand to. Defaults to 50

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.MinimumShouldMatch
member.summary: A value controlling how many "should" clauses in the resulting boolean query should match. It can be an absolute value, a percentage or a combination of both.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.Operator
member.summary: The operator used if no explicit operator is specified. The default operator is

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchQuery.PrefixLength
member.summary: Set the prefix length for fuzzy queries. Default is 0.

member.summary: If the analyzer used removes all tokens in a query like a stop filter does, the default behavior is to match no documents at all. In order to change that, can be used, which accepts (default) and which corresponds to a match_all query.

member.summary: A cutoff frequency that allows specifying an absolute or relative document frequency where high frequency terms are moved into an optional subquery and are only scored if one of the low frequency (below the cutoff) terms in the case of , or all of the low frequency terms in the case of an match.

member.summary: Controls how the query is rewritten if is set. In this scenario, the default is .

member.name: P:Nest.MultiMatchQuery.FuzzyTranspositions
member.summary:
Sets whether transpositions are supported in fuzzy queries.
The default metric used by fuzzy queries to determine a match is the Damerau-Levenshtein distance formula which supports transpositions. Setting transposition to false will switch to classic Levenshtein distance. If not set, Damerau-Levenshtein distance metric will be used.

member.summary: The operator used if no explicit operator is specified. The default operator is

member.summary: The analyzer name used to analyze the query

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.AnalyzeWildcard
member.summary: By default, wildcards terms in a query are not analyzed. By setting this value to true, a best effort will be made to analyze those as well.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.DefaultField
member.summary: The default field for query terms if no prefix field is specified. Defaults to the index.query.default_field index settings, which in turn defaults to *. * extracts all fields in the mapping that are eligible to term queries and filters the metadata fields. All extracted fields are then combined to build a query when no prefix field is provided.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.MaximumDeterminizedStates
member.summary: Limit on how many automaton states regexp queries are allowed to create. This protects against too-difficult (e.g. exponentially hard) regexps. Defaults to 10000.

member.name: P:Nest.IQueryStringQuery.MinimumShouldMatch
member.summary: A value controlling how many "should" clauses in the resulting boolean query should match. It can be an absolute value, a percentage or a combination of both.

member.summary: Sets the default slop for phrases. If zero, then exact phrase matches are required. Default value is 0.

member.summary: The query to be parsed

member.summary: A suffix to append to fields for quoted parts of the query string. This allows to use a field that has a different analysis chain for exact matching.

member.name: P:Nest.IMatchAllQuery.NormField
member.summary: When indexing, a boost value can either be associated on the document level, or per field. The match all query does not take boosting into account by default. In order to take boosting into account, the norms_field needs to be provided in order to explicitly specify which field the boosting will be done on (Note, this will result in slower execution time).

member.name: T:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm
member.summary: Multi term query rewrite method

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.ConstantScore
member.summary: A rewrite method that performs like constant_score_boolean when there are few matching terms and otherwise visits all matching terms in sequence and marks documents for that term. Matching documents are assigned a constant score equal to the query’s boost.

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.ScoringBoolean
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into a should clause in a boolean query, and keeps the scores as computed by the query. Note that typically such scores are meaningless to the user, and require non-trivial CPU to compute. This rewrite method will hit too many clauses failure if it exceeds the boolean query limit (defaults to 1024).

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.ConstantScoreBoolean
member.summary: Similar to scoring_boolean except scores are not computed. Instead, each matching document receives a constant score equal to the query’s boost. This rewrite method will hit too many clauses failure if it exceeds the boolean query limit (defaults to 1024).

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.TopTermsN
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, and keeps the scores as computed by the query. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow boolean max clause count. The N controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.TopTermsBoostN
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, but the scores are only computed as the boost. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow the boolean max clause count. The N controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: F:Nest.RewriteMultiTerm.TopTermsBlendedFreqsN
member.summary: A rewrite method that first translates each term into should clause in boolean query, but all term queries compute scores as if they had the same frequency. In practice the frequency which is used is the maximum frequency of all matching terms. This rewrite method only uses the top scoring terms so it will not overflow boolean max clause count. The N controls the size of the top scoring terms to use.

member.name: T:Nest.IDistanceFeatureQuery
member.summary: Boosts the relevance score of documents closer to a provided origin date or point. For example, you can use this query to give more weight to documents closer to a certain date or location. You can use the distance_feature query to find the nearest neighbors to a location. You can also use the query in a bool search’s should filter to add boosted relevance scores to the bool query’s scores.

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeatureQuery
member.summary:
A query that only works on rank_feature fields and rank_features fields. Its goal is to boost the score of documents based on the values of numeric features. It is typically put in a should clause of a bool query so that its score is added to the score of the query.
Compared to using function_score or other ways to modify the score, this query has the benefit of being able to efficiently skip non-competitive hits when track_total_hits is not set to true. Speedups may be spectacular.

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeatureFunction
member.summary: A function to boost scores in a rank_feature query, using the values of rank features.

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeatureLogarithmFunction
member.summary: Gives a score that is equal to log(scaling_factor + S) where S is the value of the rank feature and scaling_factor is a configurable scaling factor. Scores are unbounded. This function only supports rank features that have a positive score impact.

member.name: P:Nest.IRankFeatureLogarithmFunction.ScalingFactor
member.summary: The scaling factor

member.name: P:Nest.RankFeatureLogarithmFunction.ScalingFactor
member.summary: The scaling factor

member.name: M:Nest.RankFeatureLogarithmFunctionDescriptor.ScalingFactor(System.Single)
member.summary: The scaling factor

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeatureSaturationFunction
member.summary: Gives a score that is equal to S / (S + pivot) where S is the value of the rank feature and pivot is a configurable pivot value so that the result will be less than 0.5 if S is less than pivot and greater than 0.5 otherwise. Scores are always is (0, 1). If the rank feature has a negative score impact then the function will be computed as pivot / (S + pivot), which decreases when S increases.

member.name: T:Nest.IRankFeatureSigmoidFunction
member.summary:
is an extension of saturation which adds a configurable exponent. Scores are computed as S^exp^ / (S^exp^ + pivot^exp^). Like for the saturation function, pivot is the value of S that gives a score of 0.5 and scores are in (0, 1).
exponent must be positive, but is typically in [0.5, 1]. A good value should be computed via training. If you don’t have the opportunity to do so, we recommend that you stick to the saturation function instead.

member.name: P:Nest.IRankFeatureSigmoidFunction.Exponent
member.summary: The exponent. Must be positive

member.name: P:Nest.RankFeatureSigmoidFunction.Exponent
member.summary: The exponent. Must be positive

member.name: M:Nest.RankFeatureSigmoidFunctionDescriptor.Exponent(System.Single)
member.summary: The exponent. Must be positive

member.name: T:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest
member.summary: Creates a new follower index that is configured to follow the referenced leader index. When this API returns, the follower index exists, and cross-cluster replication starts replicating operations from the leader index to the follower index

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.LeaderIndex
member.summary: the name of the index in the leader cluster to follow

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxReadRequestOperationCount
member.summary: the maximum number of operations to pull per read from the remote cluster

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxOutstandingReadRequests
member.summary: the maximum number of outstanding reads requests from the remote cluster

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxRequestSize
member.summary: the maximum size in bytes of per read of a batch of operations pulled from the remote cluster

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxWriteRequestOperationCount
member.summary: the maximum number of operations per bulk write request executed on the follower

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxWriteRequestSize
member.summary: the maximum total bytes of operations per bulk write request executed on the follower

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxOutstandingWriteRequests
member.summary: the maximum number of outstanding write requests on the follower

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxWriteBufferCount
member.summary: the maximum number of operations that can be queued for writing; when this limit is reached, reads from the remote cluster will be deferred until the number of queued operations goes below the limit

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxWriteBufferSize
member.summary: the maximum total bytes of operations that can be queued for writing; when this limit is reached, reads from the remote cluster will be deferred until the total bytes of queued operations goes below the limit

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.MaxRetryDelay
member.summary: the maximum time to wait before retrying an operation that failed exceptionally; an exponential backoff strategy is employed when retrying

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateFollowIndexRequest.ReadPollTimeout
member.summary: the maximum time to wait for new operations on the remote cluster when the follower index is synchronized with the leader index; when the timeout has elapsed, the poll for operations will return to the follower so that it can update some statistics, and then the follower will immediately attempt to read from the leader again

member.summary: Specifies how data searches are split into time chunks.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Frequency
member.summary: The interval at which scheduled queries are made while the datafeed runs in real time. The default value is either the bucket span for short bucket spans, or, for longer bucket spans, a sensible fraction of the bucket span.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Indices
member.summary: A list of index names to search within, wildcards are supported.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.JobId
member.summary: A numerical character string that uniquely identifies the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.Query
member.summary: Describe the query to perform using a query descriptor lambda.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.QueryDelay
member.summary: The number of seconds behind real time that data is queried. For example, if data from 10:04 a.m. might not be searchable until 10:06 a.m., set this property to 120 seconds. The default value is 60s.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutDatafeedRequest.ScriptFields
member.summary: Specifies scripts that evaluate custom expressions and returns script fields to the datafeed. The detector configuration in a job can contain functions that use these script fields.

member.summary: Update a machine learning Job

member.summary: Optionally specifies runtime limits for the job. Requires a restart.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.BackgroundPersistInterval
member.summary: The time between each periodic persistence of the model. The default value is a randomized value between 3 to 4 hours, which avoids all jobs persisting at exactly the same time. The smallest allowed value is 1 hour. Requires a restart.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.CustomSettings
member.summary: Contains custom meta data about the job.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.Description
member.summary: An optional description of the job

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.ModelPlotConfig
member.summary: This advanced configuration option stores model information along with the results. This adds overhead to the performance of the system and is not feasible for jobs with many entities

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.ModelSnapshotRetentionDays
member.summary: The time in days that model snapshots are retained for the job. Older snapshots are deleted. The default value is 1 day.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.RenormalizationWindowDays
member.summary: The period over which adjustments to the score are applied, as new data is seen.

member.name: P:Nest.IUpdateJobRequest.ResultsRetentionDays
member.summary: The number of days for which job results are retained. Once per day at 00:30 (server time), results older than this period are deleted from Elasticsearch. The default value is null, which means results are retained.

member.summary: A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on it's rewrite method ie. if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Aggregations
member.summary: Specifies the aggregations to perform

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Collapse
member.summary:
Allows to collapse search results based on field values. The collapsing is done by selecting only the top sorted document per collapse key. For instance the query below retrieves the best tweet for each user and sorts them by number of likes.
NOTE: The collapsing is applied to the top hits only and does not affect aggregations. You can only collapse to a depth of 2.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Explain
member.summary: Enables explanation for each hit on how its score was computed

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.From
member.summary: The starting from index of the hits to return. Defaults to 0.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Highlight
member.summary: Allow to highlight search results on one or more fields. The implementation uses the either lucene fast-vector-highlighter or highlighter.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.IndicesBoost
member.summary: Allows to configure different boost level per index when searching across more than one indices. This is very handy when hits coming from one index matter more than hits coming from another index (think social graph where each user has an index).

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.MinScore
member.summary: Allows to filter out documents based on a minimum score

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.PostFilter
member.summary: Specify a query to apply to the search hits at the very end of a search request, after aggregations have already been calculated. Useful when both search hits and aggregations will be returned in the response, and a filter should only be applied to the search hits.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Profile
member.summary: The Profile API provides detailed timing information about the execution of individual components in a query. It gives the user insight into how queries are executed at a low level so that the user can understand why certain queries are slow, and take steps to improve their slow queries.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Query
member.summary: Specify the search query to perform

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Rescore
member.summary: Specify one or more queries to use for rescoring

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.ScriptFields
member.summary: Allows to return a script evaluation (based on different fields) for each hit

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.SearchAfter
member.summary: Sort values that can be used to start returning results "after" any document in the result list.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Size
member.summary: The number of hits to return. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Slice
member.summary: For scroll queries that return a lot of documents it is possible to split the scroll in multiple slices which can be consumed independently

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Sort
member.summary: Specifies how to sort the search hits

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Source
member.summary:
Specify how the _source field is returned for each search hit.
When true, _source retrieval is enabled (default)
When false, _source retrieval is disabled, and no _source will be returned for each hit
When is specified, fields to include/exclude can be controlled

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Suggest
member.summary: The suggest feature suggests similar looking terms based on a provided text by using a suggester

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.TerminateAfter
member.summary: The maximum number of documents to collect for each shard, upon reaching which the query execution will terminate early. If set, the response will have a boolean field terminated_early to indicate whether the query execution has actually terminated_early.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Timeout
member.summary: A search timeout, bounding the search request to be executed within the specified time value and bail with the hits accumulated up to that point, when expired. Defaults to no timeout.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.TrackScores
member.summary: Make sure we keep calculating score even if we are sorting on a field.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchRequest.Version
member.summary: Return a version for each search hit

member.summary: Indicate if an error should be returned if there is a partial search failure or timeout

member.summary: The analyzer to use for the query string

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.BatchedReduceSize
member.summary: The number of shard results that should be reduced at once on the coordinating node. This value should be used as a protection mechanism to reduce the memory overhead per search request if the potential number of shards in the request can be large.

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.CcsMinimizeRoundtrips
member.summary: Indicates whether network round-trips should be minimized as part of cross-cluster search requests execution

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.DefaultOperator
member.summary: The default operator for query string query (AND or OR)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Df
member.summary: The field to use as default where no field prefix is given in the query string

member.summary: Whether to expand wildcard expression to concrete indices that are open, closed or both.

member.summary: Whether specified concrete, expanded or aliased indices should be ignored when throttled

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.IgnoreUnavailable
member.summary: Whether specified concrete indices should be ignored when unavailable (missing or closed)

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.Lenient
member.summary: Specify whether format-based query failures (such as providing text to a numeric field) should be ignored

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.MaxConcurrentShardRequests
member.summary: The number of concurrent shard requests per node this search executes concurrently. This value should be used to limit the impact of the search on the cluster in order to limit the number of concurrent shard requests

member.name: P:Nest.SearchRequest.PreFilterShardSize
member.summary: A threshold that enforces a pre-filter roundtrip to prefilter search shards based on query rewriting if the number of shards the search request expands to exceeds the threshold. This filter roundtrip can limit the number of shards significantly if for instance a shard can not match any documents based on it's rewrite method ie. if date filters are mandatory to match but the shard bounds and the query are disjoint.

member.summary: Specify the node or shard the operation should be performed on (default: random)

member.name: T:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest
member.summary:
This API enables you to create a rollup job. The job will be created in a STOPPED state, and must be started with the Start Job API.
You must have manage or manage_rollup cluster privileges to use this API.

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.Cron
member.summary: A cron string which defines when the rollup job should be executed.

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.Groups
member.summary: Defines the grouping fields that are defined for this rollup job

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.IndexPattern
member.summary: The index, or index pattern, that you wish to rollup. Supports wildcard-style patterns (logstash-*).

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.Metrics
member.summary: Defines the metrics that should be collected for each grouping tuple

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.PageSize
member.summary: The number of bucket results that should be processed on each iteration of the rollup indexer. A larger value will tend to execute faster, but will require more memory during processing.

member.name: P:Nest.ICreateRollupJobRequest.RollupIndex
member.summary: The index that you wish to store rollup results into. Can be shared with other rollup jobs.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutUserRequest.Password
member.summary: The user’s password. Passwords must be at least 6 characters long.
member.remarks: When adding a user, one of or is required. When updating an existing user, the password is optional, so that other fields on the user (such as their roles) may be updated without modifying the user’s password.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutUserRequest.PasswordHash
member.summary: A hash of the user’s password. This must be produced using the same hashing algorithm as has been configured for password storage. Using this parameter allows the client to pre-hash the password for performance and/or confidentiality reasons. The parameter and the parameter cannot be used in the same request.

member.name: P:Nest.IPutUserRequest.Roles
member.summary: A set of roles the user has. The roles determine the user’s access permissions. To create a user without any roles, specify an empty list.

summary.para: You’ve reached the last page when there is no cursor returned in the results. Like Elasticsearch’s scroll, SQL may keep state in Elasticsearch to support the cursor. Unlike scroll, receiving the last page is enough to guarantee that the Elasticsearch state is cleared.

member.summary:
Request for ClearCursor

members.member:
You’ve reached the last page when there is no cursor returned in the results. Like Elasticsearch’s scroll, SQL may keep state in Elasticsearch to support the cursor. Unlike scroll, receiving the last page is enough to guarantee that the Elasticsearch state is cleared.
>

member.name: P:Nest.IQuerySqlRequest.Cursor
member.summary:
Continue to the next page by sending back the cursor field returned in the previous response.
You’ve reached the last page when there is no cursor returned in the results. Like Elasticsearch’s scroll, SQL may keep state in Elasticsearch to support the cursor. Unlike scroll, receiving the last page is enough to guarantee that the Elasticsearch state is cleared.

member.name: P:Nest.IQuerySqlRequest.Columnar
member.summary: Return the results in a columnar fashion: one row represents all the values of a certain column from the current page of results. The following formats can be returned in columnar orientation: json, yaml, cbor and smile.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.ActionModes
member.summary: Determines how to handle the watch actions as part of the watch execution.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.AlternativeInput
member.summary: When present, the watch uses this object as a payload instead of executing its own input.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.IgnoreCondition
member.summary: If this is set to true the watch execution will use the Always Condition.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.RecordExecution
member.summary: If this is set to true the WatchRecord generated by executing the watch will be persisted to the .watcher_history index for the current time. Also the status of the watch is updated, possbily throttling subsequent executions.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.SimulatedActions
member.summary: This field can either be a list of action ids or the string _all. If _all is set or an action that is executed by the watch appears in this list it will be executed in simulated mode.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.TriggerData
member.summary: This structure will be parsed as a trigger event and used for the watch execution.

member.name: P:Nest.IExecuteWatchRequest.Watch
member.summary: When present, this watch is used instead of the one specified in the request. This watch is not persisted to the index and record_execution cannot be set.

member.name: T:Nest.IFieldCollapse
member.summary:
Allows to collapse search results based on field values. The collapsing is done by selecting only the top sorted document per collapse key. For instance the query below retrieves the best tweet for each user and sorts them by number of likes.
NOTE: The collapsing is applied to the top hits only and does not affect aggregations.

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldCollapse.Field
member.summary: The field used for collapsing must be a single valued keyword or number field with doc-values activated

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldCollapse.InnerHits
member.summary: It is also possible to expand each collapsed top hits with the `inner_hits` option.

member.name: P:Nest.IFieldCollapse.MaxConcurrentGroupSearches
member.summary: The expansion of the group is done by sending an additional query for each inner_hit request for each collapsed hit returned in the response. This can significantly slow things down if you have too many groups and/or inner_hit requests. The max_concurrent_group_searches request parameter can be used to control the maximum number of concurrent searches allowed in this phase. The default is based on the number of data nodes and the default search thread pool size.

member.name: P:Nest.FieldCollapse.Field

member.name: P:Nest.FieldCollapse.MaxConcurrentGroupSearches
member.summary: The expansion of the group is done by sending an additional query for each inner_hit request for each collapsed hit returned in the response. This can significantly slow things down if you have too many groups and/or inner_hit requests. The max_concurrent_group_searches request parameter can be used to control the maximum number of concurrent searches allowed in this phase. The default is based on the number of data nodes and the default search thread pool size.

member.name: F:Nest.BoundaryScanner.Characters
member.summary: (default mode for the FVH): allows to configure which characters (boundary_chars) constitute a boundary for highlighting. It’s a single string with each boundary character defined in it (defaults to .,!? \t\n). It also allows configuring the boundary_max_scan to control how far to look for boundary characters (defaults to 20). Works only with the Fast Vector Highlighter.

member.name: F:Nest.BoundaryScanner.Sentence
member.summary: sentence and word: use Java’s BreakIterator to break the highlighted fragments at the next sentence or word boundary. You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: F:Nest.BoundaryScanner.Word
member.summary: sentence and word: use Java’s BreakIterator to break the highlighted fragments at the next sentence or word boundary. You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryChars
member.summary: Defines what constitutes a boundary for highlighting when using the fast vector highlighter. It's a single string with each boundary character defined in it. It defaults to .,!? \t\n.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryMaxScan
member.summary: Controls how far to look for boundary characters. Defaults to 20.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryScanner
member.summary: When highlighting a field using the unified highlighter or the fast vector highlighter, you can specify how to break the highlighted fragments using boundary_scanner

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.BoundaryScannerLocale
member.summary: You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.Encoder
member.summary: Define how highlighted text will be encoded. It can be either default (no encoding) or html (will escape html, if you use html highlighting tags).

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.Fragmenter
member.summary: Fragmenter can control how text should be broken up in highlight snippets. However, this option is applicable only for the Plain Highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.FragmentOffset
member.summary: Controls the margin to start highlighting from when using the fast vector highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.FragmentSize
member.summary: The size of the highlighted fragment, in characters. Defaults to 100

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.NoMatchSize
member.summary: In the case where there is no matching fragment to highlight, the default is to not return anything. Instead, we can return a snippet of text from the beginning of the field by setting no_match_size (default 0) to the length of the text that you want returned. The actual length may be shorter or longer than specified as it tries to break on a word boundary.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.NumberOfFragments
member.summary: The maximum number of fragments to return. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.Order
member.summary: The order in which highlighted fragments are sorted

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.PostTags
member.summary: Controls the post tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlight.PreTags
member.summary: Controls the pre tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: T:Nest.HighlighterType
member.summary: Type of highlighter

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterType.Plain
member.summary: Plain Highlighter. Uses the Lucene highlighter. It tries hard to reflect the query matching logic in terms of understanding word importance and any word positioning criteria in phrase queries.

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterType.Fvh
member.summary: Fast Vector Highlighter. If term_vector information is provided by setting term_vector to with_positions_offsets in the mapping then the fast vector highlighter will be used instead of the plain highlighter

member.name: F:Nest.HighlighterType.Unified
member.summary: Unified Highlighter. The default choice. The unified highlighter can extract offsets from either term vectors, or via re-analyzing text. Under the hood it uses Lucene UnifiedHighlighter which picks its strategy depending on the field and the query to highlight. Independently of the strategy this highlighter breaks the text into sentences and scores individual sentences as if they were documents in this corpus, using the BM25 algorithm. It supports accurate phrase and multi-term (fuzzy, prefix, regex) highlighting

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryChars
member.summary: Defines what constitutes a boundary for highlighting when using the fast vector highlighter. It's a single string with each boundary character defined in it. It defaults to .,!? \t\n.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryMaxScan
member.summary: Controls how far to look for boundary characters. Defaults to 20.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryScanner
member.summary: When highlighting a field using the unified highlighter or the fast vector highlighter, you can specify how to break the highlighted fragments using boundary_scanner

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.BoundaryScannerLocale
member.summary: You can further specify boundary_scanner_locale to control which Locale is used to search the text for these boundaries.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.Field
member.summary: The field on which to perform highlighting.
member.remarks: In order to perform highlighting, the actual content of the field is required. If the field in question is stored (has store set to true in the mapping) it will be used, otherwise, the actual _source will be loaded and the relevant field will be extracted from it.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.ForceSource
member.summary: Forces the highlighting to highlight fields based on the source even if fields are stored separately.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.Fragmenter
member.summary: Fragmenter can control how text should be broken up in highlight snippets. However, this option is applicable only for the Plain Highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.FragmentOffset
member.summary: Controls the margin to start highlighting from when using the fast vector highlighter

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.FragmentSize
member.summary: The size of the highlighted fragment, in characters. Defaults to 100

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.HighlightQuery
member.summary: The query to use for highlighting

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.MatchedFields
member.summary: Combine matches on multiple fields to highlight a single field when using the fast vector highighter. This is most intuitive for multifields that analyze the same string in different ways. All matched fields must have term_vector set to with_positions_offsets, but only the field to which the matches are combined is loaded so only that field would benefit from having store set to yes.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.NoMatchSize
member.summary: The length of a snippet of text from the beginning of the field to return when no match for highlighting is found. Default behaviour is to not return anything when a match is not found. The actual length may be shorter than specified as it tries to break on a word boundary.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.NumberOfFragments
member.summary: The maximum number of fragments to return. Defaults to 5.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.Order
member.summary: The order in which highlighted fragments are sorted. Only valid for the unified highlighter.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.PhraseLimit
member.summary: Controls the number of matching phrases in a document that are considered. Prevents the highlighter from analyzing too many phrases and consuming too much memory. When using matched_fields, phrases per matched field are considered. Raising the limit increases query time and consumes more memory. Only supported by the highlighter. Defaults to 256.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.PostTags
member.summary: Controls the post tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.PreTags
member.summary: Controls the pre tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.RequireFieldMatch
member.summary: Determines if only fields that hold a query match will be highlighted. Set to false will cause any field to be highlighted regardless of whether the query matched specifically on them. Default behaviour is true.

member.name: P:Nest.IHighlightField.TagsSchema
member.summary: Use a specific "tag" schemas.
member.remarks: Currently a single schema called "styled" with the following pre_tags: <em class="hlt1">, <em class="hlt2">, <em class="hlt3">, <em class="hlt4">, <em class="hlt5">, <em class="hlt6">, <em class="hlt7">, <em class="hlt8">, <em class="hlt9">, <em class="hlt10">

member.name: P:Nest.HighlightField.PhraseLimit
member.summary: Controls the number of matching phrases in a document that are considered. Prevents the highlighter from analyzing too many phrases and consuming too much memory. When using matched_fields, phrases per matched field are considered. Raising the limit increases query time and consumes more memory. Only supported by the highlighter. Defaults to 256.

member.name: P:Nest.HighlightField.PostTags
member.summary: Controls the post tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.HighlightField.PreTags
member.summary: Controls the pre tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.

member.name: P:Nest.HighlightField.RequireFieldMatch
member.summary: Determines if only fields that hold a query match will be highlighted. Set to false will cause any field to be highlighted regardless of whether the query matched specifically on them. Default behaviour is true.

member.name: P:Nest.HighlightField.TagsSchema
member.summary: Use a specific "tag" schemas.
member.remarks: Currently a single schema called "styled" with the following pre_tags: <em class="hlt1">, <em class="hlt2">, <em class="hlt3">, <em class="hlt4">, <em class="hlt5">, <em class="hlt6">, <em class="hlt7">, <em class="hlt8">, <em class="hlt9">, <em class="hlt10">

member.name: P:Nest.HighlightField.Type
member.summary: The type of highlighter to use. Can be a defined or custom highlighter

member.name: M:Nest.HighlightFieldDescriptor`1.Field(Nest.Field)
member.summary: The field on which to perform highlighting.
member.remarks: In order to perform highlighting, the actual content of the field is required. If the field in question is stored (has store set to true in the mapping) it will be used, otherwise, the actual _source will be loaded and the relevant field will be extracted from it.

member.name: M:Nest.HighlightFieldDescriptor`1.TagsSchema(System.Nullable{Nest.HighlighterTagsSchema})
member.summary: Use a specific "tag" schemas.
member.remarks: Currently a single schema called "styled" with the following pre_tags: <em class="hlt1">, <em class="hlt2">, <em class="hlt3">, <em class="hlt4">, <em class="hlt5">, <em class="hlt6">, <em class="hlt7">, <em class="hlt8">, <em class="hlt9">, <em class="hlt10">

member.name: M:Nest.HighlightFieldDescriptor`1.ForceSource(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Forces the highlighting to highlight fields based on the source even if fields are stored separately.

member.summary: The type of highlighter to use. Can be a defined or custom highlighter

member.summary: Controls the pre tag in which to wrap highights. By default, the highlighting will wrap highlighted text in and . Using the fast vector highlighter, there can be more tags, and the importance is ordered.
